verses.latin: Anno tertio regni Ioakim regis Iuda, venit Nabuchodonosor rex Babylonis in Ierusalem, et obsedit eam.
verses.english: In the third year of the reign of Joakim, king of Judah, Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, came to Jerusalem and besieged it.

verses.latin: Et tradidit Dominus in manu ejus Ioakim regem Iuda, et partem vasorum domus Dei: et asportavit ea in terram Sennaar in domum dei sui, et vasa intulit in domum thesauri dei sui.
verses.english: And the Lord gave Joakim, the king of Judah, into his hand, along with a portion of the vessels of the house of God, and he carried them off to the land of Sennaar, to the house of his god. He then placed the vessels in the house of the treasury of his god.

verses.latin: Dixit autem rex Asphenez praeposito eunuchorum, ut induceret de filiis Israel, et de semine regio et tyrannorum,
verses.english: Then the king spoke to Asphenez, the chief of the eunuchs, ordering him to bring in some of the sons of Israel, both from the royal family and from the nobles,

verses.latin: pueros in quibus nulla esset macula, et decori, et scientes omnem sapientiam, et doctos disciplina, et eruditos scientiis, et qui possent stare in palatio regis, ut docerent eos litteras, et linguam Chaldaeorum.
verses.english: young men without any defects, handsome, and skilled in all wisdom, learned, and possessing knowledge, and those who could stand in the king's palace, so that they might teach them the letters and the language of the Chaldeans.

verses.latin: Fuitque inter eos de filiis Iuda Daniel, Ananias, Misael, et Azarias.
verses.english: Among them were Daniel, Ananias, Misael, and Azarias, who were from the sons of Judah.

verses.latin: Et dedit eis praepositus eunuchorum nomina: Danieli, Baltassar: Ananiae, Sidrach: Misaeli, Misach: et Azariae, Abdenago.
verses.english: And the chief of the eunuchs gave them names: to Daniel, Belteshazzar; to Ananias, Shadrach; to Misael, Meshach; and to Azarias, Abed-nego.

verses.latin: Proposuit autem Daniel in corde suo, ne contaminaret se de mensa regis, neque de vino quod bibebat; et rogavit eunuchorum praepositum, ut non contaminaretur.
verses.english: But Daniel resolved in his heart that he would not defile himself with the king's food or with the wine that he drank. Therefore, he requested of the chief of the eunuchs that he might not be defiled.

verses.latin: Dedit autem Deus Danieli gratiam et misericordiam in conspectu principis eunuchorum.
verses.english: And God gave Daniel grace and mercy in the sight of the chief of the eunuchs.

verses.latin: Dixitque princeps eunuchorum ad Danielem: Timeo ego dominum meum regem, qui constituit vobis cibum et potum: qui si viderit vultus vestros macilentiores prae ceteris adolescentibus coaetaneis vestris, quid vobis faciet caput meum apud regem?
verses.english: And the chief of the eunuchs said to Daniel, “I am afraid of my lord the king, who has appointed your food and drink. If he sees your faces looking worse than those of the other young men of your age, what will happen to my head because of you?”

verses.latin: Dixit itaque Daniel ad Malasar, quem constituerat praepositus eunuchorum super Danielem, Ananiam, Misaelem, et Azariam:
verses.english: Then Daniel said to the guard whom the chief of the eunuchs had appointed over Daniel, Ananias, Misael, and Azarias:

verses.latin: Tenta nos, obsecro, diebus decem, et dentur nobis legumina ad vescendum, et aqua ad bibendum:
verses.english: “Please test us for ten days, and let them give us vegetables to eat and water to drink.

verses.latin: et comprobandi sunt vultus nostri coram te, et vultus puerorum, qui vescuntur cibo regio: et quodcumque videris, fac cum servis tuis.
verses.english: Then let our faces be examined before you, as well as the faces of the young men who eat the king's food; and deal with your servants according to what you see.”

verses.latin: Qui, audiens hanc rem, tentavit eos diebus decem.
verses.english: So, when he heard this, he tested them for ten days.

verses.latin: Post dies autem decem, apparuerunt vultus eorum meliores, et corpulentiores prae omnibus pueris, qui comedebant cibos regis.
verses.english: And after ten days, their faces appeared better and their bodies more robust than all the young men who ate the king's food.

verses.latin: Dabat itaque eis Malasar cibos, et potum, et legumina.
verses.english: So Malasar continued to provide them with food and drink and vegetables.

verses.latin: Pueris autem his dedit Deus scientiam, et disciplinam, in omni libro, et sapientia: Danieli autem intelligentiam omnium visionum et somniorum.
verses.english: As for these four children, God gave them knowledge and skill in all literature and wisdom. And Daniel understood all visions and dreams.

verses.latin: Cumque completi essent dies, post quos praeceperat rex ut introducerentur, introduxit eos praepositus eunuchorum in conspectu Nabuchodonosor.
verses.english: When the time came for them to be brought in, as the king had commanded, the chief of the eunuchs brought them in before Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.latin: Cumque locutus fuisset eis rex, inventi sunt cunctis pueris, Daniel, Ananias, Misael, et Azarias: et steterunt in conspectu regis.
verses.english: And when the king spoke with them, he found none like Daniel, Ananias, Misael, and Azarias. So they stood before the king.

verses.latin: Et in omni causa verbi sapientiae, quam interrogabat eos rex, invenit eos decies meliores cunctis videntibus et magis.
verses.english: And in every matter of wisdom and understanding about which the king questioned them, he found them ten times better than all the magicians and astrologers who were in his whole kingdom.

verses.latin: Fuit autem Daniel usque ad annum primum Cyri regis.
verses.english: And Daniel remained there until the first year of King Cyrus.

verses.latin: Anno secundo regni Nabuchodonosor, vidit Nabuchodonosor somnium: et conturbatus est spiritus ejus, et somnium ejus avolat.
verses.english: In the second year of his reign, Nebuchadnezzar had a dream, and his spirit was so troubled that he couldn't sleep.

verses.latin: Jussit ergo rex convocare magos, et aruspices, et incantatores, et chaldaeos, ut indicarent ei somnium suum. Qui cum venissent, steterunt coram rege.
verses.english: So the king commanded all the magicians, sorcerers, enchanters, and astrologers to tell him his dream. And they all stood before the king.

verses.latin: Et ait eis: Somnium vidi, et conturbatus sum: et ignorans quod viderim.
verses.english: The king told them, "I've had a dream, and I am troubled. I don't even know what it was."

verses.latin: Responderunt Chaldaei regi in lingua syriaca: Rex, in aeternum vive: dic somnium servo tuo, et interpretationem ejus ostendemus.
verses.english: The Chaldeans answered the king in the Aramaic language, "May the king live forever. Tell us the dream, your servants, and we will tell you the interpretation."

verses.latin: Respondens rex, ait Chaldaeis: Sermo recessit a me: nisi indicaveritis mihi somnium, et interpretationem ejus, in vincula mittemini, et domus vestrae vocabuntur captivae.
verses.english: The king replied to the Chaldeans, "I have made a decision. If you don't tell me the dream and its interpretation, you will be torn apart, and your houses will be demolished."

verses.latin: Si autem somnium, et interpretationem ejus narraveritis, praemia, et dona, et gloriam magnam accipietis a me. Ideo somnium, et interpretationem ejus indicate mihi.
verses.english: But if you tell me the dream and its interpretation, you will receive rewards, gifts, and great honor from me. So tell me the dream and its interpretation."

verses.latin: Responderunt secundo, et dixerunt: Dic somnium servo tuo, rex, et interpretationem ejus ostendemus.
verses.english: They answered again, "Tell the dream to your servants, O king, and we will show you the interpretation."

verses.latin: Respondit rex, et ait: Certe novi quod tempus amittitis: sciéntes quod recessit a me sermo.
verses.english: The king replied, "I know you are trying to gain time, because you know that the thing has been decided by me."

verses.latin: Si ergo somnium non indicaveritis mihi, una est sententia de vobis. Et interpretationem mendacem, et fallacem praeparastis dicere coram me, donec tempus transeat. Ideo dicite mihi somnium, ut sciam quod etiam interpretationem ejus vera dicatis.
verses.english: If you do not tell me the dream, there is only one verdict for you. You have prepared lying and deceitful words to speak before me, until the situation changes. So tell me the dream, so that I can know that you can also tell me its true interpretation."

verses.latin: Responderunt Chaldaei coram rege, et dixerunt: Non est homo super terram, qui hoc verbum possit indicare: quia rex magnorum verborum postulat, et nullus est alius qui possit indicare ante regem, nisi dii, quorum non est cum carni conversatio.
verses.english: The Chaldeans responded to the king, saying, "There is not a man on earth who can tell the king this. The king demands something that is beyond human ability; there is no one else who can tell the king, except for the gods, and they do not live among humans."

verses.latin: Propter hoc rex iratus est, et nimio furore commotus, et praecepit ut interirent omnes sapientes Babylonis.
verses.english: Because of this, the king became furious and very angry and ordered the execution of all the wise men of Babylon.

verses.latin: Cumque edictum exisset, et sapientes interimiebantur, quaerebantur et Daniel et socii ejus ut perirent.
verses.english: When the decree went out, and the wise men were about to be killed, Daniel and his companions were sought so that they could also be executed.

verses.latin: Tunc Daniel respondens, cum consilio et prudentia, dixit Arioch principi militum regis, qui egressus fuerat ut interimerei sapientes Babylonis.
verses.english: Then Daniel, with his wisdom, responded to Arioch, the chief of the king's guards, who had gone out to kill the wise men of Babylon.

verses.latin: Et ait: Quare hoc edictum tam cito exivit a facie regis? Et Arioch ait: Quia inveni sapientes de filiis Israël, qui indicarent regi interpretationem somnii.
verses.english: And he asked, "Why did the king issue such a quick decree?" Arioch replied, "Because I have found some of the exiles from Judah who can tell the king the interpretation of the dream."

verses.latin: Ingressus est Daniel, et rogavit regem ut daret sibi tempus ad interpretationem indicandam regi.
verses.english: Daniel went in and asked the king for time to explain the interpretation to him.

verses.latin: Et Daniel abiit, et rogavit socios suos, ut quaererent misericordiam a Deo caeli super mysterio isto: et non perirent Daniel et socii ejus cum ceteris sapientibus Babylonis.
verses.english: Daniel then went to his companions and asked them to seek mercy from the God of heaven concerning this mystery, so that Daniel and his companions would not be executed with the other wise men of Babylon.

verses.latin: Tunc mysterium Danieli per visionem in somnio revelatum est: et Daniel benedixit Deum caeli.
verses.english: Then the mystery was revealed to Daniel in a vision in his dream. Daniel blessed the God of heaven.

verses.latin: Et respondens Daniel, dixit: Sit nomen Dei benedictum a saeculo et usque in saeculum: quia sapientia et fortitudo ejus est.
verses.english: Daniel responded, saying: "Blessed be the name of God from eternity to eternity because wisdom and power belong to Him."

verses.latin: Et ipse mutat tempora et aetates; transfert regna, et constituit: dat sapientiam sapientibus, et scientiam scientibus secreta.
verses.english: He changes times and seasons; He deposes kings and establishes them. He gives wisdom to the wise and knowledge to those who know mysteries.

verses.latin: Revelat profunda et abscondita, et novit in tenebris constituta: et lux cum eo est.
verses.english: He reveals deep and hidden things; He knows what is in darkness, and the light dwells with Him.

verses.latin: Tibi, Deus patrum meorum, confiteor, et te laudo, quia sapientiam et fortitudinem dedisti mihi: et nunc ostendisti mihi quae rogavimus te, quia verbum regis ostendisti nobis.
verses.english: I give thanks and praise to you, God of my ancestors, for You have given me wisdom and power. And now You have made known to me what we asked of You, for You have made known to us the king's message."

verses.latin: Propter hoc Daniel ingressus est ad Arioch, quem constituerat rex ut perderet sapientes Babylonis, et dixit ei: Sapientes Babylonis ne perdas: introduce me coram rege, et interpretationem ostendam regi.
verses.english: Therefore, Daniel went to Arioch, whom the king had appointed to kill the wise men of Babylon, and said to him, "Do not kill the wise men of Babylon. Bring me before the king, and I will show him the interpretation."

verses.latin: Tunc Arioch festinus introduxit Danielem ad regem, et dixit ei: Inveni hominem de filiis transmigrationis Juda, qui interpretationem regi annuntiet.
verses.english: Then Arioch quickly brought Daniel before the king and said to him, "I have found a man of the exiles from Judah who will make known the interpretation to the king."

verses.latin: Respondens rex, dixit Danieli, cujus nomen erat Baltassar: Potes tu mihi indicare somnium quod vidi, et interpretationem ejus?
verses.english: The king responded to Daniel, whose name was Belteshazzar, "Can you tell me the dream that I saw and its interpretation?"

verses.latin: Et respondit Daniel coram rege, et ait: Mysterium quod rex interrogat, non possunt sapientes, et magi, et aruspices, et arioli, indicare regi.
verses.english: Daniel answered the king, saying, "The mystery that the king is asking cannot be revealed to the king by wise men, magicians, enchanters, or astrologers."

verses.latin: Sed est Deus in caelo, qui revelat mysteria: et ipse indicavit tibi, rex Nabuchodonosor, quae ventura sunt in novissimo tempore. Somnium tuum, et visiones capitis tui in lectulo tuo, haec sunt.
verses.english: But there is a God in heaven who reveals mysteries. And He has made known to you, O king Nebuchadnezzar, what will happen in the last days. Your dream and the visions of your head upon your bed are these:

verses.latin: Tu rex cogitabas in te, quid esset futurum post haec: et qui revelat mysteria, ostendit tibi quae ventura sunt.
verses.english: As for you, O king, your thoughts came to your mind concerning what would happen after this, and He who reveals mysteries has made known to you what will happen.

verses.latin: Mihi quoque hoc mysterium revelatum est, non quia sapientiam habeo super omnes viventes: sed ut interpretatio regi manifestaretur, et sententiam mentis ejus scires.
verses.english: As for me, this mystery has been revealed to me, not because I have more wisdom than anyone else, but so that the interpretation may be made known to the king, and that you may understand the thoughts of your mind.

verses.latin: Tu, rex, videbas, et ecce statua una grandis: statua illa grandis, et mirabilis, stabat coram te: et erat aspectus ejus terribilis.
verses.english: You, O king, saw a great statue. That great statue, shining with extraordinary brilliance, stood before you, and its appearance was terrifying.

verses.latin: Caput statuae ex auro optimo erat, et pectus et brachia de argento, et venter et femora ex aere:
verses.english: The head of the statue was made of fine gold, its chest and arms of silver, its belly and thighs of bronze,

verses.latin: Tibiae autem ferreae, pedum pars, ferrea et pars, fictilis.
verses.english: its legs of iron, and its feet, partly of iron and partly of clay.

verses.latin: Aspiciebas donec lapis abscisus est de monte sine manibus: et percussit statuam, et comminuit pedes ejus, qui erant ferrei et fictiles, et contrivit eos.
verses.english: You were looking on until a stone was cut out of a mountain, but not by human hands; and it struck the statue on its feet of iron and clay, and crushed them.

verses.latin: Tunc contrita sunt pariter ferrum, testa, aes, argentum et aurum, et redacta quasi pulvis ex area aestiva, et abstulit ea ventus: et nullus locus inventus est eis.
verses.english: Then the iron, the clay, the bronze, the silver, and the gold were all crushed together and became like chaff on the summer threshing floor; the wind blew them away, so that no trace of them could be found.

verses.latin: Lapis autem, qui percusserat statuam, factus est mons magnus, et implevit universam terram.
verses.english: But the stone that struck the statue became a great mountain and filled the whole earth.

verses.latin: Hoc est somnium: interpretationem ejus dicemus coram rege.
verses.english: This is the dream; now we will tell the interpretation before the king.

verses.latin: Tu rex, rex regum, quibus regnum Deus caeli dedit, fortitudinem, et imperium, et gloriam:
verses.english: You, O king, are the king of kings, to whom the God of heaven has given the kingdom, the power, and the glory.

verses.latin: et in quocumque habitant filii hominum, bestiae agri, volucresque caeli, dedit in manu tua: et tradidit omnia in potestatem tuam: tu es ergo caput aureum.
verses.english: Wherever the children of humanity live, and the beasts of the field and the birds of the sky, He has given them into your hand and has made you rule over all of them; you are the head of gold.

verses.latin: Et post te regnum aliud suscipietur minus te: et regnum tertium aereum, quod imperabit in universa terra.
verses.english: And after you, another kingdom will arise, inferior to yours, and then a third kingdom of bronze, which shall rule over all the earth.

verses.latin: Et regnum quartum quasi ferrum: quomodo ferrum conterit et domat omnia, sic conteret et comminuet omnia haec.
verses.english: And the fourth kingdom shall be as strong as iron, for as iron breaks in pieces and crushes everything, so shall it break in pieces and crush all these.

verses.latin: Quod autem vidisti pedes, et digitos ex parte testae figuli, et ex parte ferri, regnum divisum erit: et de robore ferri erit in eo, sicut vidisti ferrum mixtum testae fictilis.
verses.english: And whereas you saw the feet and toes, partly of potters' clay and partly of iron, it shall be a divided kingdom, but the strength of the iron shall be in it, just as you saw the iron mixed with the clay of the potter.

verses.latin: Et digitos pedum ex parte ferreos, et ex parte fictiles, ex parte regnum erit forte, et ex parte contritum.
verses.english: And as the toes of the feet were partly of iron and partly of clay, so the kingdom shall be partly strong and partly fragile.

verses.latin: Quod autem vidisti ferrum mixtum testae fictilis, commiscebuntur quidem humano semine, sed non adhaerebunt sibi, quomodo ferrum misceri non potest testae.
verses.english: And as you saw iron mixed with clay, they will mingle with the seed of men, but they will not cleave to one another, even as iron cannot be mixed with clay.

verses.latin: In diebus autem regnorum illorum suscitabit Deus caeli regnum, quod in aeternum non dissipabitur: et regnum ejus alteri populo non tradetur: comminuet et consumet universa regna haec, et ipsum stabit in aeternum.
verses.english: And in the days of those kingdoms, the God of heaven will set up a kingdom which shall never be destroyed, and the kingdom will not be given to another people; it shall break in pieces and consume all these kingdoms, and it shall stand forever.

verses.latin: Pro eo quod videris, quod de monte abscisus est lapis sine manibus, et contrivit testam, et ferrum, et aes, et argentum, et aurum, Deus magnus ostendit regi quae ventura sunt post haec: et verum est somnium, et fidelis interpretatio ejus.
verses.english: Because you saw that a stone was cut out of the mountain without hands, and that it broke in pieces the clay, the iron, the bronze, the silver, and the gold, the great God has made known to the king what shall come to pass after this; the dream is true, and the interpretation of it is faithful.

verses.latin: Tunc rex Nabuchodonosor cecidit in faciem suam, et Danieli adoravit, et victimas et thura jussit ei sacrificare.
verses.english: Then King Nebuchadnezzar fell on his face and paid homage to Daniel and commanded that they should present to him sacrifices and incense.

verses.latin: Respondensque rex Danieli, ait: Vere Deus vester Deus deorum est, et dominus regum, et revelator mysteriorum: quoniam potuisti revalare hoc secretum.
verses.english: The king answered Daniel, saying, "Truly, your God is the God of gods, and the Lord of kings, and a revealer of mysteries, for you have been able to reveal this secret."

verses.latin: Tunc rex Danieli respondens, dixit: Vere Deus vester Deus deorum est, et dominus regum, et revelator mysteriorum: quoniam potuisti revalare hoc secretum.
verses.english: Then the king made Daniel great and gave him many gifts and made him ruler over the whole province of Babylon and chief prefect over all the wise men of Babylon.

verses.latin: Post haec Daniel postulavit a rege, et constituit super opera provinciae Babylonis Sadarch, Misach, et Abdenago: ipse autem Daniel in porta regis erat.
verses.english: Then Daniel requested of the king, and he appointed Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego over the affairs of the province of Babylon, while Daniel was at the king's court.

verses.latin: Rex Nabuchodonosor fecit statuam auream, altitudine cubitorum sexaginta, latitudine cubitorum sex. Et statuit eam in campo Durae provinciae Babylonis.
verses.english: King Nebuchadnezzar built a golden statue, sixty cubits tall and six cubits wide. He set it up on the plain of Dura in the province of Babylon.

verses.latin: Moxque misit ad convocandos satrapas, et magistratus, et judices, duces, et optimates, et praefectos, et omnes principes provinciarum, ut convenirent ad dedicationem statuae, quam constituerat.
verses.english: He then sent out word to summon the satraps, magistrates, judges, generals, nobles, prefects, and all the leaders of the provinces, so they would come to the dedication of the statue he had set up.

verses.latin: Tunc congregati sunt satrapae, magistratus, et judices, duces, et optimates, et praefecti, et omnes principes provinciarum ad dedicationem statuae, quam constituerat Nabuchodonosor: stabantque coram statua, quam posuerat.
verses.english: So the satraps, magistrates, judges, generals, nobles, prefects, and all the leaders of the provinces gathered for the dedication of the statue that Nebuchadnezzar had set up. They stood before the statue that he had placed there.

verses.latin: Praeco autem clamabat valenter: Vobis dicitur, populi, gentes, et tribus:
verses.english: Then a herald proclaimed loudly: "People, nations, and language groups, you are commanded:

verses.latin: in hora qua audieritis sonitum tubae, fistulae, et citharae, sambucae, et psalterii, et symphoniae, et universorum generum musicorum, statim, ut cadatis, et adoretis statuam auream, quam constituit Nabuchodonosor rex.
verses.english: When you hear the sound of the trumpet, flute, and cithara, the sambuca, harp, and symphony, and every kind of musical instrument, you must immediately bow down and worship the golden statue that King Nebuchadnezzar has set up.

verses.latin: Quicumque autem non adoraverit, in eadem hora mittetur in fornacem ignis ardentis.
verses.english: Whoever does not worship it will, at that moment, be thrown into a blazing furnace of fire.

verses.latin: Ideo igitur in tempore, cum audissent omnes populi sonitum tubae, fistulae, et citharae, sambucae, et psalterii, et symphoniae, et omnis generis musicorum, irruerunt omnes populi, tribus, et linguae, et adoraverunt statuam auream, quam constituerat Nabuchodonosor rex.
verses.english: Therefore, when all the peoples heard the sound of the trumpet, flute, cithara, sambuca, harp, symphony, and every kind of musical instrument, all the peoples, tribes, and languages fell down and worshiped the golden statue that King Nebuchadnezzar had set up.

verses.latin: In eodem igitur tempore accedentes viri Chaldaei accusaverunt Judaeos.
verses.english: At that moment, certain Chaldeans came and accused the Jews.

verses.latin: Dixeruntque ad Nabuchodonosor regem: Rex, in aeternum vive.
verses.english: They said to King Nebuchadnezzar, "O king, live forever!

verses.latin: Tu, rex, posuisti decretum, ut omnis homo, qui audierit sonitum tubae, fistulae, et citharae, sambucae, et psalterii, et symphoniae, et omnis generis musicorum, prosternat se, et adoret statuam auream:
verses.english: You, O king, made a decree that every man who hears the sound of the trumpet, flute, cithara, sambuca, harp, symphony, and every kind of musical instrument must bow down and worship the golden statue,

verses.latin: si quis autem non prociderit, et adoraverit, mittatur in fornacem ignis ardentis.
verses.english: and if anyone does not bow down and worship, he is to be thrown into a blazing furnace of fire.

verses.latin: Sunt ergo viri Judaei, quos constituisti super opera provinciae Babylonis, Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago: viri isti contempserunt, rex, decretum tuum, deos tuos non colunt, et statuam auream, quam constitui, non adorant.
verses.english: But there are certain Jewish men, whom you appointed over the affairs of the province of Babylon, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. These men, O king, have disregarded your decree. They do not serve your gods, and they do not worship the golden statue that I have set up.”

verses.latin: Tunc Nabuchodonosor in furore et in ira jussit adducere Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago. Qui statim adducti sunt in conspectu regis.
verses.english: Then Nebuchadnezzar, in fury and anger, commanded that Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego be brought. And they were immediately brought before the king.

verses.latin: Proposuitque eis Nabuchodonosor rex, et dixit: Verene, Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, deos meos non colitis, et statuam auream, quam constitui, non adoratis?
verses.english: King Nebuchadnezzar spoke to them and said, “Is it true, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, that you do not serve my gods, and that you do not worship the golden statue that I have set up?

verses.latin: Nunc igitur, si parati estis, quacumque hora audieritis sonitum tubae, fistulae, citharae, sambucae, et psalterii, et symphoniae, et omnis generis musicorum, prosternite vos, et adorate statuam, quam feci: sin autem, nescio quis est Deus qui eruat vos de manu mea.
verses.english: Now, therefore, if you are ready, whenever you hear the sound of the trumpet, flute, cithara, sambuca, harp, symphony, and every kind of musical instrument, bow down and worship the statue that I have made. But if you do not worship, I do not know what god will rescue you from my hand.”

verses.latin: Responderunt Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, regi Nabuchodonosor: Non oportet nos de hac re respondere tibi.
verses.english: Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego replied to King Nebuchadnezzar, “We do not need to answer you about this matter.

verses.latin: Ecce enim Deus noster, quem colimus, potest eripere nos de camino ignis ardentis, et de manu tua, o rex, liberare.
verses.english: Behold, our God, whom we serve, is able to rescue us from the blazing furnace of fire, and to deliver us from your hand, O king.

verses.latin: Quod si noluerit, notum sit tibi, rex, quia deos tuos non colimus, et statuam auream, quam constituisti, non adoramus.
verses.english: But even if He does not, let it be known to you, O king, that we will not serve your gods or worship the golden statue that you have set up.”

verses.latin: Tunc Nabuchodonosor repletus est furore, et aspectus vultus ejus immutatus est super Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, et praecepit ut succenderetur fornax septuplum quam erat consueverat succendi.
verses.english: Then Nebuchadnezzar was filled with fury, and the appearance of his face was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego. He ordered that the furnace be heated seven times more than it was usually heated.

verses.latin: Et viris fortissimis de exercitu suo jussit ut ligarent pedes Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago: et mitterent eos in fornacem ignis ardentis.
verses.english: He commanded certain strong men in his army to bind the feet of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, and to cast them into the blazing furnace of fire.

verses.latin: Tunc viri isti vincti, cum tunicis suis et bracis, et tiaris, et vestibus suis, missi sunt in medium fornacis ignis ardentis.
verses.english: Then these men, bound with their tunics, trousers, hats, and other garments, were cast into the middle of the blazing furnace of fire.

verses.latin: Nam jussu regis instante, fornax erat succensa nimis: porro autem viros illos, qui miserant Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, interfecit flamma ignis.
verses.english: Because the king’s command was urgent, the furnace was heated exceedingly hot. But the flames of the fire killed the men who had cast Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego into it.

verses.latin: Viri autem hi tres, id est, Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, ceciderunt in medio fornacis ignis ardentis, ligati.
verses.english: But these three men, namely Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, fell into the middle of the blazing furnace of fire, bound.

verses.latin: Tunc Nabuchodonosor rex obstupuit, et surrexit cito, et ait optimatibus suis: Nonne tres viros misimus in medium ignis vinctos? Qui respondentes dixerunt regi: Vere, rex.
verses.english: Then King Nebuchadnezzar was astonished, and he quickly rose and said to his nobles, “Did we not cast three men, bound, into the middle of the fire?” They answered and said to the king, “Truly, O king.”

verses.latin: Respondit, et ait: Ecce ego video quatuor viros solutos, et ambulantes in medio ignis, et nihil corruptionis in eis est, et species quarti similis filio Dei.
verses.english: He replied, “Look! I see four men unbound, walking in the middle of the fire, and there is no harm in them, and the appearance of the fourth is like a son of God.”

verses.latin: Tunc accessit Nabuchodonosor ad ostium fornacis ignis ardentis, et ait: Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, servi Dei altissimi, egredimini, et venite. Statimque egressi sunt Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago de medio ignis.
verses.english: Then Nebuchadnezzar approached the door of the blazing furnace of fire and said, “Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, servants of the Most High God, come out, and come here.” Then Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego came out of the middle of the fire immediately.

verses.latin: Et congregati satrapae, et magistratus, et judices, et potentes regis contemplabantur viros istos, quod ignis nullam in eis habuisset potestatem, et capillus capitis eorum non esset adustus, et sarabarae eorum non fuissent immutatae, et odor ignis non transisset per eos.
verses.english: And the satraps, magistrates, judges, and the king’s powerful men gathered to observe these men, and they saw that the fire had no power over their bodies. Not a hair of their heads was singed, their tunics were not damaged, and the smell of fire had not passed over them.

verses.latin: Respondens Nabuchodonosor, dixit: Benedictus Deus eorum, Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, qui misit angelum suum, et eripuit servos suos, qui crediderunt in eum: et verbum regis immutaverunt, et tradiderunt corpora sua, ne servirent, et adorarent omnem deum, praeter Deum suum.
verses.english: Nebuchadnezzar responded and said, “Blessed be the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, who sent His angel and delivered His servants who trusted in Him. They defied the king’s word, and yielded their bodies rather than serve and worship any god except their own God.

verses.latin: Ideoque a me constitutum est, ut omnis populus, tribus, et lingua, qui locutus fuerit blasphemiam contra Deum Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago, intereat, et domus eorum vastentur: quoniam nullus est alius Deus, qui possit ita salvare.
verses.english: Therefore, I have made a decree that any people, tribe, or language group that speaks against the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego shall be torn limb from limb, and their houses shall be made into a garbage heap. For there is no other god who can save in this way.”

verses.latin: Tunc rex promovit Sidrach, Misach, et Abdenago in provincia Babylonis.
verses.english: Then the king promoted Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego in the province of Babylon.

verses.latin: Rex Nabuchodonosor universis populis, gentibus, et linguis, qui habitant in universa terra: pax vobis multiplicetur.
verses.english: From King Nebuchadnezzar, to all peoples, nations, and languages who dwell in all the earth: may peace be multiplied to you.

verses.latin: Signa et prodigia, quae fecit Deus excelsus in me, placuerunt mihi.
verses.english: It seemed good to me to reveal the signs and wonders which the Most High God has done for me.

verses.latin: Quam magna sunt signa eius, et quam fortius prodigia eius! regnum eius regnum sempiternum, et potestas eius in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: How great are His signs, and how mighty His wonders! His kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and His power is unto all generations.

verses.latin: Ego Nabuchodonosor eram in domo mea, et florebam in palatio meo.
verses.english: I, Nebuchadnezzar, was at rest in my house, and flourishing in my palace.

verses.latin: Vidi somnium, quod conturbavit me: et cogitationes meae in pavore meo, in cubili meo, et visa capitis mei conturbabant me.
verses.english: I saw a dream which terrified me; and my thoughts in my bed, and the visions of my head troubled me.

verses.latin: Et ex hoc decretum a me positum est, ut introducerentur coram me omnes sapientes Chaldæorum, ut somnium mihi indicarent.
verses.english: Therefore, I issued a decree to bring in before me all the wise men of the Chaldeans, that they might make known to me the interpretation of the dream.

verses.latin: Et ingressi sunt magi, arioli, Chaldæi, et aruspex: et somnium narravi coram eis: et interpretationem eius non indicaverunt mihi.
verses.english: Then came in the magicians, the astrologers, the Chaldeans, and the soothsayers, and I told the dream before them: but they did not make known to me the interpretation thereof.

verses.latin: Tandem intravit coram me Daniel, cuius nomen Baltassar, iuxta nomen dei mei, qui habet spiritum deorum sanctorum: et somnium eius narravi coram eo.
verses.english: But at last Daniel came in before me, whose name is Belteshazzar, according to the name of my god, and who has in him the spirit of the holy gods; and I told the dream before him.

verses.latin: Baltassar, princeps magorum, quia ego scio quod spiritus deorum sanctorum est in te, et omne secretum non est tibi impossibile: somnium visionum mearum, quas vidi, et interpretationem eius dic mihi.
verses.english: “Belteshazzar, prince of the magicians, because I know that the spirit of the holy gods is in you, and that no secret is impossible to you, tell me the vision of my dream that I have seen, and the interpretation thereof.

verses.latin: Visio autem capitis mei in cubili meo haec erat: Videbam, et ecce arbor in medio terrae, et altitudo eius nimia.
verses.english: This was the vision of my head in my bed: I saw, and behold, a tree in the midst of the earth, and the height thereof was exceeding great.

verses.latin: Arbor grandis et fortis, et altitudo eius tangens caelum: aspectus eius, erat in extremis universae terrae.
verses.english: The tree was great and strong, and the height thereof reached unto heaven, and the sight thereof was to the ends of all the earth.

verses.latin: Folia eius pulcherrima, et fructus eius nimius, et esca universae in ea: subter eam habitabant animalia, et volucres caeli in ramis eius: et ex ea pascebatur omnis caro.
verses.english: Its leaves were most beautiful, and its fruit exceeding much, and in it was food for all: the beasts of the field dwelt under it, and the birds of the air inhabited in its branches, and all flesh was fed from it.

verses.latin: Videbam in visione capitis mei in cubili meo, et ecce vigil et sanctus de caelo descendit.
verses.english: I saw in the vision of my head in my bed, and behold, a watcher and a holy one came down from heaven.

verses.latin: Clamabat fortiter, et dicebat: Concidite arborem, et succidite eam: sed tamen germen radicum eius in terra relinquite, et in vinculis ferri et aëris in herba foris.
verses.english: He cried aloud, and said thus: “Cut down the tree, and cut off its branches: shake off its leaves, and scatter its fruit: let the beasts fly from under it, and the birds from its branches.

verses.latin: Aqua caeli rore rigetur, et cum bestiis terrae pars eius in herba: septem tempora mutentur super eum.
verses.english: Nevertheless, leave the stump of its roots in the earth, and let it be bound with a band of iron and brass, among the grass, outside.

verses.latin: Hoc est decretum vigilum, et sermo sanctorum, et petitio, ut vivant scientes, et ut cognoscant viventes, quoniam dominatur Altissimus in regno hominum: et cui voluerit, dabit illud, et humillimum hominum constituet super illud.
verses.english: Let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let its portion be with the beasts of the earth, till seven times pass over it.

verses.latin: Hoc somnium vidi ego rex Nabuchodonosor. Tu ergo Baltassar, interpreta cito: quia omnes sapientes regni mei non possunt interpretationem indicare mihi: tu autem potes, quia spiritus deorum sanctorum est in te.
verses.english: This is the decree of the watchers, and the sentence of the holy ones, and the demand, that the living may know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men: and He will give it to whomever He will, and He will appoint the most humble of men over it.”

verses.latin: Tunc Baltassar, cui nomen est Baltassar, obstupuit quasi per unam horam: et cogitationes eius conturbabant eum. Respondit autem rex, et dixit: Baltassar, somnium, et interpretatio eius non conturbent te. Respondit Baltassar, et dixit: Domine mi, somnium his qui te oderunt, et interpretatio eius inimicis tuis.
verses.english: This is the dream I, King Nebuchadnezzar, have seen. You, therefore, Belteshazzar, tell me quickly the interpretation: for all the wise men of my kingdom cannot tell me the interpretation; but you can, because the spirit of the holy gods is in you.”

verses.latin: Arbor, quam vidisti, grandis et fortis, cuius altitudo tangens caelum, aspectus eius in universa terra,
verses.english: Then Belteshazzar, whose name is Belteshazzar, was greatly troubled for about an hour: and his thoughts disturbed him. The king answered and said: “Belteshazzar, let not the dream, nor its interpretation, trouble you.” Belteshazzar answered and said: “My lord, may the dream be to those who hate you, and its interpretation to your enemies!

verses.latin: et cuius rami pulchri, et fructus eius nimius, et esca universae in ea, in qua habitabat bestia agri, et volucres caeli, et omnis caro pascebatur ex ea,
verses.english: The tree that you saw, which was great and strong, whose height reached to heaven, whose sight was to the ends of the earth,

verses.latin: tu es, rex, qui magnificatus es, et incrassatus: et magnitudo tua crevit, et pervenit usque ad caelum, et potestas tua in terminos universae terrae.
verses.english: And its branches were beautiful, and its fruit exceedingly much, and in it was food for all; under which the beasts of the field dwelt, and the birds of the air built their nests, and all flesh was fed from it,

verses.latin: Quod autem vidit rex vigil, et sanctus de caelo descendens, et dicens: Concidite arborem, et disperdete eam: sed germen radicum eius in terra relinquite, et in vinculis ferri et aëris, et in herba foris, et rore caeli rigetur, et cum bestiis terrae sit, donec septem tempora mutentur super eum:
verses.english: you, O king, are that tree, for you have grown and become strong, and your greatness has grown, and has reached to heaven, and your power to the ends of the whole earth.

verses.latin: Interpretatio est haec, rex, et sententia Excelsi, quae venit super dominum meum regem:
verses.english: And whereas the king saw a watcher and a holy one coming down from heaven, and saying, “Cut down the tree, and destroy it: but leave the stump of its roots in the earth, and let it be bound with a band of iron and brass, among the grass, and let it be wet with the dew of heaven, and let its portion be with the beasts, until seven times pass over it,”

verses.latin: Expellent te inter homines, et cum bestiis erit habitatio tua: et foenum sicut boves comedes, et rore caeli rigaberis: et septem tempora mutabuntur super te, donec scias quod dominetur Altissimus in regno hominum, et det illud cuicumque voluerit.
verses.english: this is the interpretation, O king, and this is the decree of the Most High, which will come upon my lord the king:

verses.latin: Quod autem iussit, ut relinqueretur germen radicum eius, in terra: regnum tuum relinquent tibi, et in terra habitabis cum bestiis, et foenum quasi boves comedes, et rore caeli rigaberis: et septem tempora mutabuntur super te, donec scias quod dominetur Deus in regno hominum.
verses.english: They will cast you out from among men, and your dwelling will be with the beasts; you will eat grass like an ox, and you will be wet with the dew of heaven; and seven times will pass over you, until you know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men, and gives it to whomever He will.

verses.latin: Iubentis autem ut relinqueretur germen radicum eius: regnum tuum firmum manebit tibi, postquam cognoveris quod potestas in caelo est.
verses.english: And whereas they commanded that the stump of the roots of the tree should be left in the earth: your kingdom will remain to you, and you will dwell in the earth with the beasts, and you will eat grass like an ox, and you will be wet with the dew of heaven; and seven times will pass over you, until you know that God rules in the kingdom of men.

verses.latin: Ideo, rex, consilium meum placeat tibi: et peccata tua eleemosynis redime, et iniquitates tuas misericordiis pauperum: forte ignoscet peccatis tuis.
verses.english: Therefore, O king, let my counsel please you: and redeem your sins by alms, and your iniquities with works of mercy for the poor: perhaps He will forgive your sins.

verses.latin: Omnia haec venerunt super regem Nabuchodonosor.
verses.english: All these things came upon King Nebuchadnezzar.

verses.latin: Post duodecim autem menses, in palatio regis Babylonis, ambulabat.
verses.english: At the end of twelve months, he was walking in the palace of the king of Babylon.

verses.latin: Et respondit rex, et dixit: Nonne haec est Babylon magna, quam ego aedificavi in domum regni, in fortitudine roboris mei, et in gloria decoris mei?
verses.english: The king spoke, and said: “Is not this great Babylon, which I have built for the house of the kingdom, in the strength of my power, and in the glory of my splendor?”

verses.latin: Sed dum sermo iste in ore regis esset, vox de caelo sonuit: Tibi dicunt, rex Nabuchodonosor: regnum tuum transiit a te:
verses.english: While this word was still in the mouth of the king, a voice came down from heaven: “To you it is spoken, O king Nebuchadnezzar: The kingdom is departed from you.

verses.latin: Et de hominibus expellent te, et cum bestiis erit habitatio tua: foenum quasi boves comedes: et septem tempora transibunt super te, donec scias quod dominetur Altissimus in regno hominum.
verses.english: And they will cast you out from among men, and your dwelling will be with the beasts; you will eat grass like an ox, and seven times will pass over you, until you know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men.”

verses.latin: In eadem hora sermo completus est super Nabuchodonosor: et de hominibus expulsum est, et foenum ut bos comedit, et rore caeli corpus eius rigabatur, donec capilli eius in similitudinem aquilarum crescerent, et ungues eius quasi avium.
verses.english: In that very hour, the word was fulfilled upon Nebuchadnezzar: and he was cast out from among men, and ate grass like an ox, and his body was wet with the dew of heaven, until his hairs grew like eagles' feathers, and his nails like birds' claws.

verses.latin: Igitur post diem finem, ego Nabuchodonosor oculos meos ad caelum levavi: et sensus meus redditus est mihi: et Altissimo benedixi: et viventem in sempiternum laudavi et glorificavi: cuius potestas potestas sempiterna, et regnum in generationem et generationem.
verses.english: Now at the end of the days, I, Nebuchadnezzar, lifted up my eyes to heaven: and my understanding returned to me: and I blessed the Most High, and I praised and glorified Him that lives forever: whose power is an everlasting power, and His kingdom is to generation and generation.

verses.latin: Et omnes habitatores terrae apud eum in nihilum reputati sunt: quia juxta voluntatem suam facit tam in virtute caeli, quam in habitatoribus terrae: et nemo est qui manu eius possit resistere, et dicat ei: Quare fecisti?
verses.english: And all the inhabitants of the earth are regarded as nothing before Him: because He does according to His will in the power of the heavens, and in the inhabitants of the earth: and there is no one who can resist His hand and say to Him: “Why have you done this?”

verses.latin: In eodem tempore sensus meus reversus est ad me: et ad honorem regni mei, decoremque meum reversus sum: et gloria mea restituta est mihi: et ministri mei, et optimates mei quaerebant me, et in regno meo constitutus sum: et magnitudo mihi addita est.
verses.english: At that time, my understanding returned to me: and I returned to the honor of my kingdom, and to my beauty: and my glory was restored to me: and my ministers and my officers sought me, and I was established in my kingdom: and my greatness was added to me.

verses.latin: Nunc igitur ego Nabuchodonosor laudo, et magnifico, et glorifico regem caeli: quia omnia opera eius vera, et viae eius iudicia, et gradientes in superbia, potest humiliare.
verses.english: Now, therefore, I, Nebuchadnezzar, praise, and magnify, and glorify the King of heaven: because all His works are true, and His ways are judgments, and those who walk in pride He can humiliate.

verses.latin: Baltassar rex fecit grande convivium optimatibus suis mille, et coram mille bibebat vinum.
verses.english: King Baltassar held a huge banquet for a thousand of his nobles, and he drank wine with them.

verses.latin: Jussitque Baltassar, inflamatus vinolentia, ut afferrentur vasa aurea et argentea, quae asportaverat Nabuchodonosor pater ejus de templo, quod fuit in Jerusalem, ut biberent in eis rex, et optimates ejus, et uxores ejus, et concubinae ejus.
verses.english: Baltassar, fired up by the wine, ordered that the gold and silver vessels be brought in. His father Nabuchodonosor had taken these vessels from the temple in Jerusalem, so that the king, his nobles, his wives, and his concubines could drink from them.

verses.latin: Tunc allata sunt vasa aurea et argentea, quae asportaverat de templo, quod fuit in Jerusalem: et biberunt in eis rex, et optimates ejus, uxores et concubinae ejus.
verses.english: So the gold and silver vessels, which had been taken from the temple in Jerusalem, were brought in. And the king, his nobles, his wives, and his concubines drank from them.

verses.latin: Bibebant vinum, et laudabant deos suos aureos, et argenteos, et aereos, et ferreos, et ligneos, et lapideos.
verses.english: They drank wine, and they praised their gods of gold, silver, bronze, iron, wood, and stone.

verses.latin: In eadem hora apparuerunt digiti quasi manus hominis scribentis contra candelabrum, in superficie parietis palatii regis: et rex aspiciebat articulos manus scribentis.
verses.english: In that very hour, the fingers of a man’s hand appeared, writing on the wall of the king’s palace. The king was watching the hand as it wrote.

verses.latin: Tunc facies regis commutata est, et cogitationes ejus conturbabant eum: et compages lumborum ejus solvebantur, et genua ejus succidebant.
verses.english: Then the king’s face changed, and his thoughts disturbed him. His waist joints loosened, and his knees were knocking together.

verses.latin: Clamavit itaque rex fortiter ut introducerentur magi, Chaldaei, et arioli: et loquens ait sapientibus Babylonis: Quicumque legerit scripturam hanc, et interpretationem ejus manifestam mihi fecerit, purpura vestietur, et torquem auream habebit in collo, et tertius in regno meo dominabitur.
verses.english: The king cried out loudly that the magicians, Chaldeans, and soothsayers be brought in. He spoke to the wise men of Babylon, saying: “Whoever reads this writing and makes its interpretation known to me, he shall be clothed in purple, and shall have a gold chain on his neck, and he shall rule as the third in my kingdom.”

verses.latin: Tunc ingressi sunt omnes sapientes regis, nec potuerunt legere scripturam, neque interpretationem indicare regi.
verses.english: Then all the king’s wise men came in, but they could neither read the writing nor explain its meaning to the king.

verses.latin: Unde rex Baltassar timore ingenti perterritus est, et vultus ejus immutatus est in eum, et optimates ejus turbabantur.
verses.english: So King Baltassar was terrified, and his face was changed, and his nobles were also greatly disturbed.

verses.latin: Tunc regina, propter verba regis et optimatum ejus, intravit in convivium, et ait: O rex, in aeternum vive: non te terreat cogitatio tua, et facies tua ne mutetur.
verses.english: The queen, because of the king’s words and those of his nobles, entered the banquet hall, and she said: “O king, live forever. Do not be terrified by your thoughts, and do not let your face change.”

verses.latin: Est vir in regno tuo, qui spiritum deorum sanctorum habet in se, et in diebus patris tui inventa est in eo sapientia et intelligentia, et doctrina sapientiae, juxta spiritum deorum: nam et rex Nabuchodonosor pater tuus, constituit eum principem magorum, ariolorum, Chaldaeorum, et divinorum,
verses.english: There is a man in your kingdom who has the spirit of the holy gods within him. In the days of your father, wisdom, understanding, and the knowledge of wisdom were found in him, according to the spirit of the gods. For King Nabuchodonosor, your father, appointed him as chief of the magicians, soothsayers, Chaldeans, and diviners,

verses.latin: eo quod spiritus amplior et scientia, et intellectus, et interpretatio somniorum, et ostensio secretorum, et solutio sermonum, inventa sint in eo: hoc est in Daniele, cui rex posuit nomen Baltassar. Nunc itaque Danielem vocet, et interpretationem ostendet.
verses.english: because a greater spirit, knowledge, understanding, the interpretation of dreams, the revealing of secrets, and the solving of difficult questions were found in him. This is Daniel, whom the king named Baltassar. Now, therefore, let Daniel be called, and he will explain the meaning.”

verses.latin: Tunc introductus est Daniel coram rege. Cui ait rex: Tu es Daniel de filiis captivitatis Juda, quem adduxit rex pater meus de Juda?
verses.english: Then Daniel was brought before the king. The king said to him: “Are you Daniel, one of the exiles from Judah, whom my father the king brought here from Judah?”

verses.latin: Audivi de te quod spiritum deorum habeas, et sapientia et intelligentia et doctrina major invenitur in te.
verses.english: I have heard of you that the spirit of the gods is within you, and that wisdom, understanding, and greater knowledge are found in you.

verses.latin: Et nunc introierunt coram me sapientes et magi, ut scripturam hanc legerent, et interpretationem ejus indicarent mihi: et non potuerunt interpretationem sermonis indicare.
verses.english: Now the wise men and the magicians have come before me to read this writing and to explain its meaning to me, but they could not explain the meaning of the message.

verses.latin: Porro ego audivi de te quod possis interpretari obscura, et solvere dubia: si igitur vales scripturam legere, et interpretationem ejus indicare mihi, purpura vestieris, et torquem auream habebis in collo tuo, et tertius in regno meo dominaberis.
verses.english: But I have heard about you that you can interpret obscure things and solve difficult questions. Therefore, if you can read this writing and explain its meaning to me, you shall be clothed in purple, and you shall have a gold chain around your neck, and you shall rule as the third in my kingdom.”

verses.latin: Tunc Daniel respondens, dixit coram rege: Munera tua sint tibi, et dona domus tuae alteri da: sed scripturam legam tibi, o rex, et interpretationem ejus ostendam tibi.
verses.english: Then Daniel answered and said before the king: “Let your gifts be for you, and give your rewards to someone else, but I will read the writing to you, O king, and I will show you its interpretation.

verses.latin: O rex, Deus altissimus dedit Nabuchodonosor patri tuo regnum, et magnitudinem, et gloriam, et honorem.
verses.english: O king, the Most High God gave Nabuchodonosor, your father, a kingdom, greatness, glory, and honor.

verses.latin: Et propter magnitudinem quam dederat ei, universi populi, tribus, et linguæ, tremuerunt et metuerunt eum: quemcumque volebat, interficiebat: et quemcumque volebat, percutiebat: et quemcumque volebat, exaltabat: et quemcumque volebat, humiliabat.
verses.english: And because of the greatness He gave him, all peoples, tribes, and languages trembled and feared him. Whoever he wanted, he killed; whoever he wanted, he struck down; whoever he wanted, he exalted; and whoever he wanted, he humbled.

verses.latin: Porro quando elevatum est cor ejus, et spiritus illius obfirmatus est in superbia, depositus est de solio regni sui, et gloria ejus ablata est.
verses.english: But when his heart was lifted up, and his spirit became hardened in pride, he was deposed from the throne of his kingdom, and his glory was taken away.

verses.latin: Et de filiis hominum ejectus est, et cor ejus cum bestiis positum est, et cum onagris erat habitatio ejus: foenum quoque ut boves comedebat, et rore caeli corpus ejus infectum est, donec cognosceret quod potestatem haberet Altissimus in regno hominum, et quemcumque voluerit, suscitabit super illud.
verses.english: He was driven away from the sons of men, and his heart was made like that of beasts, and his dwelling was with the wild donkeys. He ate grass like an ox, and his body was wet with the dew of heaven, until he acknowledged that the Most High God has power over the kingdom of men and raises up over it whomever He wills.”

verses.latin: Tu quoque filius ejus Baltassar, non humiliavit cor tuum, cum scires haec omnia,
verses.english: And you, his son Baltassar, have not humbled your heart, even though you knew all this,

verses.latin: sed contra Dominatorem caeli elevatus es: et vasa domus ejus allata sunt coram te: et tu, et optimates tui, et uxores tuae, et concubinae tuae, vinum bibistis in eis: et deos argenteos, et aureos, et aereos, et ferreos, et ligneos, et lapideos, qui non vident, neque audiunt, neque sentiunt, laudasti: Deum autem qui habet in manu sua spiritum tuum, et omnes vias tuas, non glorificasti.
verses.english: but you have exalted yourself against the Lord of heaven. The vessels of His house were brought before you, and you, your nobles, your wives, and your concubines drank wine from them. You praised the gods of silver, gold, bronze, iron, wood, and stone, which neither see nor hear nor know. But the God who holds your life in His hand and who directs all your ways, you did not glorify.

verses.latin: Ideo a parte ejus missus est digitus manus, et scripta est haec scriptura.
verses.english: Therefore, the hand was sent from Him, and this writing was inscribed.

verses.latin: Haec est autem scriptura, quae exarata est: Mane, Thecel, Phares.
verses.english: And this is the writing that was inscribed: “Mane, Thecel, Phares.”

verses.latin: Et haec est interpretatio verbi. Mane: numeravit Deus regnum tuum, et complevit illud.
verses.english: And this is the interpretation of the word: “Mane” – God has numbered your kingdom and brought it to an end.

verses.latin: Thecel: appensus es in statera, et inventus es minus habens.
verses.english: “Thecel” – You have been weighed in the balance and found wanting.

verses.latin: Phares: divisum est regnum tuum, et datum est Medis, et Persis.
verses.english: “Phares” – Your kingdom is divided and given to the Medes and Persians.

verses.latin: Tunc jussit Baltassar, et vestierunt Danielem purpura, et dederunt torquem auream in collo ejus, et praeconatus est de eo quod haberet potestatem tertius in regno suo.
verses.english: Then Baltassar gave the order, and they clothed Daniel in purple, and they put a gold chain around his neck, and they announced concerning him that he should have power as the third in his kingdom.

verses.latin: Eadem nocte interfectus est Baltassar rex Chaldaeorum.
verses.english: That very night, Baltassar the king of the Chaldeans was killed.

verses.latin: Placuit Dario constituere super regnum satrapas centum viginti, qui essent per totum regnum:
verses.english: Darius decided to set up one hundred twenty governors, who were to be in charge of the whole kingdom;

verses.latin: et super eos principes tres, quorum unus erat Daniel: ut satrapae illi redderent rationem ipsis, et rex nihil pateretur detrimenti.
verses.english: and over them, three administrators, one of whom was Daniel, so that the governors would have to report to them, and the king would take no loss.

verses.latin: Igitur Daniel superabat omnes principes et satrapas, quia spiritus Dei major erat in eo.
verses.english: Daniel surpassed all of the administrators and governors because the Spirit of God was great within him.

verses.latin: Et rex cogitabat constituere eum super totum regnum.
verses.english: The king was thinking of setting him up to have authority over the whole kingdom.

verses.latin: Super hoc ergo principes et satrapae quaerebant invenire Danielis occasionem in regni causa: et nullam causam et nullum  fictum invenire potuerunt, eo quod fidelis esset, et omnis culpa et suspicio  absens in eo esset.
verses.english: Therefore, the administrators and governors were looking for a reason to bring charges against Daniel concerning the business of the kingdom, but they were unable to find any fault or corruption in him, because he was faithful, and there was no fault or suspicion in him.

verses.latin: Igitur viri illi dixerunt: Non inveniemus Danieli hunc occasionem, nisi forte invenerimus adversum eum in lege Dei sui.
verses.english: So these men said, “We will not find any charge against this Daniel unless we find something against him concerning the law of his God.”

verses.latin: Igitur principes et satrapae hi concurrerunt ad regem, et dixerunt ei: Rex Darii, in aeternum vive!
verses.english: So these administrators and governors rushed to the king and said to him, “King Darius, live forever!

verses.latin: Consideraverunt universi principes regni, magistratus, et satrapae, consilium ut decretum imperii sanciretur, ut omnis, qui rogaret  petitionem a quocumque Deo et homine usque ad triginta dies, nisi a te, rex,  mitteretur in lacum leonum.
verses.english: All of the administrators of the kingdom, magistrates, and governors have agreed that the king should make a law that anyone who petitions any God or man for thirty days, except you, O king, should be cast into the pit of the lions.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, rex, sancito decretum, et confirma interdictum: ut secundum legem Medorum et Persarum, quod statutum est, non praetergrediatur.
verses.english: Now, O king, confirm the decree and sign the prohibition, so that it may not be changed, according to the law of the Medes and Persians.”

verses.latin: Igitur rex Darius constituit decretum, et confirmavit interdictum.
verses.english: Therefore King Darius made the decree and signed the prohibition.

verses.latin: Cum autem cognovisset Daniel quod scriptum esset decretum, introivit domum suam, et in cameris suis, detectis fenestris, tribus vicibus in die flectebat genua sua, et orabat, et confitebatur coram Deo suo, sicut facere consueverat ante.
verses.english: But when Daniel learned that the decree had been written, he went into his house, and in his upper chamber, with his windows open, three times a day he was kneeling, praying, and giving thanks before his God, just as he had been accustomed to doing before.

verses.latin: Tunc viri illi considerantes, invenerunt Danielem orantem et obsecrantem Deum suum.
verses.english: Then those men, considering the situation, found Daniel praying and imploring his God.

verses.latin: Et accesserunt, et locuti sunt regi super decreto. Rex, inquit, decretum constituisti, ut omnis homo, qui rogaret petitionem a Deo et homine, intra triginta dies, nisi a te, rex, mitteretur in lacum leonum?
verses.english: And they came and spoke to the king about the decree. They said, “Did you establish a decree, O king, that every man who asks a petition of any God or man within thirty days, except you, O king, should be cast into the pit of the lions?”

verses.latin: Respondit rex, et ait: Verus est sermo juxta  decretum  Medorum et Persarum, quod praetergredi non licet.
verses.english: The king answered and said, “The word is true according to the decree of the Medes and Persians, which it is not allowed to change.”

verses.latin: Tunc responderunt, et dixerunt coram rege: Daniel, qui est de filiis transmigrationis Juda, non curavit de lege tua, rex, neque de decreto quod posuisti: sed tres vicibus in die orat obsecrationes suas.
verses.english: Then they answered and said before the king, “Daniel, who is from the sons of the captivity of Judah, has not cared about your law, O king, nor about the decree that you made, but three times a day he makes his supplications.”

verses.latin: Quod audiens rex, valde contristatus est: et pro Daniele posuit cor suum ut  liberaret eum, et usque ad solis occasum laborabat ut erueret eum.
verses.english: When the king heard this, he was very sad, and he set his heart on freeing Daniel, and until sunset he worked to rescue him.

verses.latin: Viri autem illi considerantes ad regem, dixerunt: Scito, rex, quoniam lex Medorum et Persarum est, ut omne decretum quod constituerit rex, non liceat immutari.
verses.english: But those men, considering the matter before the king, said, “Know, O king, that it is the law of the Medes and Persians that every decree which the king establishes may not be changed.”

verses.latin: Tunc rex jussit, et adductus est Daniel, et missus est in lacum leonum. Dixitque rex Danieli: Deus tuus, quem colis semper, ipse liberet te.
verses.english: Then the king ordered, and Daniel was brought and cast into the pit of the lions. And the king said to Daniel, “May your God, whom you always worship, Himself deliver you.”

verses.latin: Allatus est autem lapis unus, et positus est super os lacus: quem signavit rex annulo suo, et annulo optimatum suorum, ne quid fieret contra Daniel.
verses.english: Then a single stone was brought, and it was placed over the mouth of the pit, which the king sealed with his own ring and with the rings of his nobles, so that nothing should happen against Daniel.

verses.latin: Egressus est autem rex in palatium suum, et dormivit incœnatus, et ante eum cibus non est allatus: insuper et somnus recessit ab eo.
verses.english: Then the king went out to his palace, and he went to sleep without eating, and food was not brought before him, and also sleep departed from him.

verses.latin: Tunc rex diluculo consurgens, festinus abiit ad lacum leonum:
verses.english: Then the king, rising at dawn, went in haste to the pit of the lions.

verses.latin: et cum adpropinquasset lacui, clamavit Daniel cum voce  dolente: et ait ad Danielem: Daniel, serve Dei viventis, numquid Deus tuus, cui tu semper servis, potuit te liberare a leonibus?
verses.english: And when he approached the pit, he cried out with a sorrowful voice to Daniel and said to Daniel, “Daniel, servant of the living God, has your God, whom you always serve, been able to deliver you from the lions?”

verses.latin: Tunc Daniel regi respondens ait: Rex, in aeternum vive!
verses.english: Then Daniel, answering the king, said, “O king, live forever!

verses.latin: Deus meus misit angelum suum, et conclusit ora leonum, et non nocuerunt mihi: quia coram eo justitia inventa est in me: sed et coram te, rex, delictum non feci.
verses.english: My God sent His angel and shut the mouths of the lions, and they did not harm me, because before Him justice was found in me, and also, O king, I have done no wrong before you.”

verses.latin: Tunc rex gavisus est super eo, et jussit educere Danielem de lacu: et eductus est Daniel de lacu, et nulla  lesio inventa est in eo, quoniam crediderat Deo suo.
verses.english: Then the king rejoiced over him, and he ordered Daniel to be brought up out of the pit, and Daniel was brought up out of the pit, and no injury was found in him because he had believed in his God.

verses.latin: Jussit autem rex, et adducti sunt viri illi, qui accusaverant Danielem, et in lacum leonum missi sunt, ipsi et filii eorum, et uxores eorum: et non venerunt usque ad terram lacui, quin irruerunt in eos leones, et omnia  eorum comminuerunt.
verses.english: And the king ordered, and those men who had accused Daniel were brought, and they were cast into the pit of lions, they, their children, and their wives, and before they reached the ground of the pit, the lions rushed upon them and crushed all of them.

verses.latin: Tunc rex Darius scripsit universis  populis, tribubus, et linguis, habitantibus in universa terra: Pax vobis multiplicetur.
verses.english: Then King Darius wrote to all peoples, tribes, and languages dwelling in all the earth, “May your peace be multiplied.

verses.latin: A me constitutum est decretum, ut in universo imperio meo trepident, et paveant Deum Danielis: ipse est enim Deus vivus, et permanens in saecula: et regnum ejus quod non corrumpetur, et potestas ejus usque in finem.
verses.english: I have made a decree that in all my kingdom they should tremble and fear the God of Daniel, for He is the living God, and He endures forever, and His kingdom is that which will not be corrupted, and His power endures to the end.

verses.latin: Liberator, et salvator, faciens signa, et portenta in caelo et in terra: qui liberavit Danielem de lacu leonum.
verses.english: He is a deliverer and a savior, working signs and wonders in the universe and on the earth, who delivered Daniel from the pit of the lions.”

verses.latin: Igitur Daniel perseveravit in regno  Darii, et in regno  Cyri Persae.
verses.english: So Daniel prospered in the reign of Darius and in the reign of Cyrus the Persian.

verses.latin: Anno primo Balthassar regis Babylonis, Daniel somnium vidit, et visa capitis sui in cubili suo: et somnium scribens, narravit summa rerum.
verses.english: In the first year of Belshazzar’s reign in Babylon, Daniel had a dream. Visions of his head came to him in his bed, and he recorded the dream. He summarized the events he had seen.

verses.latin: Dicebat Daniel: Videbam in visione mea nocte, et ecce venti quatuor de caelo impetebant in mare magnum.
verses.english: Daniel said: “In my vision that night, I saw that four powerful winds from the sky struck the great sea.

verses.latin: Et quattuor bestiae grandes ascendebant de mari, diversaę inter se.
verses.english: Then, four great beasts, each different from the others, arose from the sea.

verses.latin: Prima quasi leo, et alarum habebat aquilarum: vidi donec evulsae sunt alae ejus: et sublata est de terra, et super pedes hominis statuta est, et cor hominis datum est ei.
verses.english: The first beast was like a lion, and it had the wings of an eagle. I watched until its wings were plucked off. It was lifted up from the earth and set on its feet like a man, and a man’s heart was given to it.

verses.latin: Et ecce bestia alia secunda similis urso: et stabat in latere uno, et tres ordines dentium in ore ejus, et sic dicebant ei: Surge, comede carnes multas.
verses.english: Then I saw another beast, a second one, that was like a bear. It was propped up on one side, and it had three rows of teeth in its mouth. They said to it, 'Arise! Eat much flesh!'

verses.latin: Post haec videbam, et ecce alia quasi pardus, et habebat super dorsum ejus alas quasi avis, et bestia habebat quattuor capita: et potestas data est ei.
verses.english: After this, I saw another beast, like a leopard, with wings like those of a bird on its back. The beast had four heads, and power was given to it.

verses.latin: Post hoc aspiciebam in visionibus noctis, et ecce bestia quarta terribilis, et fortis, et nimia: dentes ferreos habebat, comedens, et comminuens, et reliqua pedibus suis conculcans: dissimilis autem erat ceteris bestiis quas videram ante eam, et habebat cornua decem.
verses.english: After this I watched in my visions at night, and saw a fourth beast—fearsome, strong, and exceedingly powerful. It had great iron teeth. It ate and crushed, and it trampled down the rest with its feet. It was different from all the other beasts I had seen before it, and it had ten horns.

verses.latin: Considerabam cornua, et ecce alius cornu pusillum ortum est de medio eorum: et tria de cornibus prioribus eradicata sunt a facie ejus: et ecce oculi quasi oculi hominis erant in cornu isto, et os loquens ingentia.
verses.english: As I was considering the horns, I saw another horn, a small one, come up among them. Three of the first horns were uprooted before it. There were eyes like the eyes of a man on this horn, and a mouth speaking great things.

verses.latin: Aspiciebam donec throni positi sunt, et antiquus dierum sedit: vestimentum ejus candidum quasi nix, et capilli capitis ejus quasi lana munda: thronus ejus flamma ignis, rotę ejus ignis succensus.
verses.english: I watched until thrones were set in place, and the Ancient of Days took His seat. His clothing was white as snow, and the hair of His head was like pure wool. His throne was a fiery flame; its wheels were a burning fire.

verses.latin: Flumen ignis profluebat a facie ejus: millia millium ministrabant ei, et myriada myriadae assistebant ei: judicium constitutum est, et libri aperti sunt.
verses.english: A stream of fire issued from before Him. Thousands upon thousands were ministering to Him, and myriads upon myriads were standing before Him. The judgment was set, and the books were opened.

verses.latin: Aspiciebam propter vocem verborum magnorum, quae cornu illud loquebatur: et vidi quod interfecta esset bestia, et perisset corpus ejus, et traditum esset ad comburendum igni:
verses.english: Then I kept watching, because of the sound of the great words that the horn was speaking. And as I watched, the beast was killed, and its body was destroyed and given to the burning fire.

verses.latin: et ceteris bestiis ablata est potestas, et longitudinis vitae data est eis usque ad tempus et tempus.
verses.english: As for the rest of the beasts, their dominion was taken away, and their lives were prolonged for a time and a season.

verses.latin: Videbam in visione noctis, et ecce cum nubibus caeli quasi filius hominis venit, et usque ad antiquum dierum venit, et in conspectu ejus oblatus est.
verses.english: I kept watching in the night visions, and I saw one like the Son of Man coming with the clouds of the sky. He came up to the Ancient of Days and was brought before Him.

verses.latin: Et dedit ei potestatem, et honorem, et regnum: et omnes populi, tribus, et linguae ipsi servient: potestas ejus, potestas aeterna, quae non auferetur: et regnum ejus, quod non corrumpetur.
verses.english: He was given dominion and glory and a kingdom, that all peoples, nations, and languages should serve Him. His dominion is an everlasting dominion, which shall not pass away, and His kingdom is one that shall not be destroyed.

verses.latin: Conturbatus est spiritus meus, ego Daniel, in medio mei, et visiones capitis mei conturbaverunt me.
verses.english: I, Daniel, was deeply troubled in my spirit, and the visions of my head alarmed me.

verses.latin: Accessi ad unum de assistentes, et veritatem ab eo rogabam de omnibus istis. Et dixit mihi: Et significationem verborum docebit mihi.
verses.english: I approached one of those standing by and asked him the truth about all this. So he told me, and explained the meaning of the words.

verses.latin: Hi quattuor bestiae magnae, quattuor regna erunt in terra, quae surgent.
verses.english: “These four great beasts are four kings, who will arise from the earth.

verses.latin: Porro sancti Dei altissimi accipient regnum: et obtinebunt regnum usque in saeculum saeculi.
verses.english: But the holy ones of the Most High will receive the kingdom, and they will possess the kingdom forever and ever.”

verses.latin: Post haec volui diligenter discere de bestia quarta, quae erat dissimilis ceteris omnibus, nimis terribilis: dentes ejus ferrei, et ungulae ejus aereae: comedens, et comminuens, et reliqua pedibus suis conculcans:
verses.english: Then I wished to learn the truth about the fourth beast, which was different from all the others, exceedingly terrifying, with iron teeth and bronze claws, which devoured, crushed, and trampled the remainder with its feet.

verses.latin: et de cornibus decem, quae habebat in capite, et de alio, quod ortum fuerat, et ante quod ceciderant tria: et de cornu illo, quod habebat oculos, et os loquens ingentia: et aspectus ejus major ceteris.
verses.english: And I wanted to know about the ten horns on its head, and about the other horn which had arisen, before which three had fallen. This horn had eyes, and a mouth speaking great things, and its appearance was greater than the rest.

verses.latin: Et aspiciebam, et cornu illud faciebat bellum contra sanctos, et obtinebat adversus eos,
verses.english: As I watched, that horn waged war against the holy ones and was prevailing over them,

verses.latin: donec venit antiquus dierum, et judicium dedit sanctis altissimi: et tempus venit, et possederunt sancti regnum.
verses.english: until the Ancient of Days came, and judgment was given to the holy ones of the Most High. The time came, and the holy ones possessed the kingdom.

verses.latin: Et ait: Bestia quarta, regnum quartum erit in terra, quod majus erit omnibus regnis, et devorabit universam terram, et conculcabit, et comminuet eam.
verses.english: So he said: “The fourth beast will be a fourth kingdom on earth, which will be greater than all the other kingdoms. It will devour the whole earth, trample it down, and crush it.

verses.latin: Et cornua decem de regno illo, decem reges erunt: et alius consurget post eos, et ipse potentior erit prioribus: et tres reges humiliabit.
verses.english: The ten horns are ten kings who will arise from this kingdom, and after them another will arise. This one will be more powerful than the former, and he will humble three kings.

verses.latin: Et verba adversum Altissimum loquetur: et sanctos Altissimi conteret: et putabit quod possit mutare tempora et leges: et tradentur in manu ejus usque ad tempus et tempora, et dimidium temporis.
verses.english: He will speak against the Most High, and wear down the holy ones of the Most High, and will think to change the times and the laws. They will be given into his hand for a time, times, and half a time.

verses.latin: Et judicium sedebit, et auferent potestatem ejus, et consument, et disperdent usque in finem.
verses.english: But the judgment will sit, and his dominion will be taken away. It will be consumed and destroyed to the end.

verses.latin: Regnum autem, et potestas, et magnitudo regni, quae est sub omni caelo, detur populo sanctorum Altissimi: cujus regnum, regnum aeternum est: et omnes potestaes servient ei, et obediebunt.
verses.english: Then the kingdom, dominion, and the greatness of the kingdoms under all the sky will be given to the people of the holy ones of the Most High. His kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and all dominions will serve and obey Him.

verses.latin: Hic finis visionis. Ego Daniel multum cogitationibus meis conturbabar, et facies mea mutata est in me: sed verbum in corde meo conservavi.
verses.english: This is the end of the vision. I, Daniel, was very troubled by my thoughts, and my face was changed, but I kept the matter in my heart.”

verses.latin: Anno tertio regni Baltassar regis, visio apparuit mihi ego Daniel, post ea quae videram in principio.
verses.english: In the third year that king Baltassar reigned, a vision appeared to me, Daniel, after the things that I had seen in the beginning.

verses.latin: Et vidi in visione, et factum est cum essem videns, eram in Susis castello, quod est in Elam provincia: et vidi in visione, et eram juxta portam Ulai.
verses.english: In the vision, I was in Susa, the capital of the province of Elam. And I saw the vision, and was standing near the gate of Ulai.

verses.latin: Et levavi oculos meos, et vidi: et ecce aries unus stabat ante paludem, cornua habens: cornua autem alta erant: et unum altioris cornus, et deinde surrexit.
verses.english: I raised my eyes, and there was a ram standing before the marsh. It had horns, but the horns were large. One horn was bigger than the other, and it rose up last.

verses.latin: Vidi arietem cornibus ventilantem contra occidentem, et contra aquilonem, et contra meridiem: et omnia bestiae non poterant resistere ei, neque liberari de manu ejus: et fecit juxta voluntatem suam, et magnificatus est.
verses.english: I saw the ram butting with its horns toward the west, the north, and the south. No animals could stand against it, nor could they be saved from its power. It acted according to its will and grew strong.

verses.latin: Et ego considerabam: et ecce hircus caprarum veniebat de occidentis plagam super faciem universae terrae, et non tangebat terram: et inter cornua ejus cornu insigne.
verses.english: I considered this, and suddenly, a male goat came from the west, crossing the whole earth. It did not touch the ground. Between its eyes was a prominent horn.

verses.latin: Et veniebat usque ad arietem illum, qui habebat cornua, quem videram stantem ante paludem: et cucurrit ad eum in impetu fortitudinis suae.
verses.english: It advanced toward the ram that had the horns, which I had seen standing near the marsh. The goat attacked it in a furious rage.

verses.latin: Et cum venisset prope arietem, iratus est adversus eum, et percussit arietem, et contrivit cornua ejus: et non poterat aries sustinere eum: projecitque eum in terram, et conculcavit eum: et non erat qui posset liberare arietem de manu ejus.
verses.english: When it approached the ram, the goat became enraged and struck the ram, breaking its horns. The ram could not stand against it. The goat threw the ram to the ground and trampled it. There was no one who could save the ram from the goat's power.

verses.latin: Hircus caprarum vero magnus intumescit nimis: et cum esset fortis, contritum est cornu magnum ejus, et surrexerunt pro eo cornua quatuor, per quatuor ventos caeli.
verses.english: The male goat swelled with pride, but at the peak of his strength, its large horn was broken. In its place, four other horns grew toward the four winds of the sky.

verses.latin: De uno autem ex eis exiit cornu unum exiguum, et increscuit contra meridiem, et contra orientem, et contra fortitudinem.
verses.english: Out of one of them, a small horn came forth, growing strong toward the south, the east, and the promised land.
