verses.latin: Et magnificatum est usque ad fortitudinem caeli: et projecit de fortitudine, et de stellis, et conculcavit eas.
verses.english: It became great, even up to the strength of the sky, and it cast down some of the stars and trampled them.

verses.latin: Et usque ad principem fortitudinis magnificatus est: et ab ipso sublata est jugatio continua, et eversum est habitaculum sanctificationis ejus.
verses.english: It even grew up to the Prince of the forces of the sky, and through it, the continual sacrifice was taken away, and the place of His sanctification was overthrown.

verses.latin: Et fortitudo data est ei contra jugum iugi propter peccata: et projecit veritatem in terram, et fecit, et successit.
verses.english: Because of sin, the forces were given to it against the continual sacrifice. It cast the truth to the ground, and it acted, and it succeeded.

verses.latin: Et audivi unum sanctum loquentem: et dixit alter sanctus ad illum, qui loquebatur: Usquequo visio, et jugum iugi, et peccatum desolationis? usquequo conculcabitur sanctificatio, et fortitudo conculcabitur?
verses.english: I heard one of the holy ones speaking, and another holy one said to the speaker, “How long will this vision last, concerning the continual sacrifice, and the sin of desolation? How long will the place of sanctification and the forces be trampled?

verses.latin: Et dixit ei: Usque ad vesperam et mane, dies duo millia et trecenti: et sanctificabitur sanctuarium ejus.
verses.english: He answered, “It will last for two thousand three hundred evenings and mornings, and then His sanctified place will be restored.”

verses.latin: Factum est autem cum ego Daniel viderem visionem, quaerebam intellectum: et ecce stetit contra me quasi species viri.
verses.english: When I, Daniel, saw the vision, I sought to understand it. Suddenly, a being like a man stood before me.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem hominis inter Ulai: et clamavit, et dixit: Gabriel, fac hunc intelligere visionem.
verses.english: I heard a man's voice from the Ulai, who called out, “Gabriel, make this man understand the vision.”

verses.latin: Et venit et stetit juxta ubi ego stabam. Et cum venisset, timui, et cecidi in faciem meam. Et dixit ad me: Intellige, fili hominis, quoniam in tempore finis, visio completa est.
verses.english: He came and stood near where I was. When he came, I was terrified and fell on my face. He said to me, “Understand, son of man, that the vision is for the time of the end.”

verses.latin: Cumque loqueretur mecum, obdormivi in terram super faciem meam: et tetigit me, et statuit me in loco meo.
verses.english: As he spoke to me, I fell into a deep sleep, with my face to the ground. He touched me and set me in my place.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Ego ostendam tibi quae ventura sunt in novissimo temporis, quoniam in tempore finis, habebit finem visio.
verses.english: He said, “I will show you what will happen in the last days, because the vision concerns the time of the end.”

verses.latin: Aries, quem vidisti, cornua habentem, rex Medorum et Persarum est.
verses.english: The ram that you saw, with the horns, represents the kings of Media and Persia.

verses.latin: Hircus caprarum, rex Graecorum est: et cornu grande, quod erat inter oculos ejus, ipse est rex primus.
verses.english: The male goat represents the king of the Greeks, and the large horn between its eyes is the first king.

verses.latin: Quod autem contritum est, et surrexerunt pro eo quatuor, pro eo stabunt quatuor regna de gente ejus, sed non in fortitudine ejus.
verses.english: That horn having been broken, and four others rising in its place, represents four kingdoms that will arise from his nation, but not with his power.

verses.latin: Et in novissimo regni eorum, cum completi fuerint iniquitates eorum, consurget rex facie contumax, et intelligens propositiones.
verses.english: In the last days of these kingdoms, when their iniquities are complete, there will arise a king of fierce appearance and skilled in intrigues.

verses.latin: Et roborabitur fortitudo ejus, et ditabit se divitiis: et dominabitur in fortitudine sua: et conteret omnia.
verses.english: His power will be great, and he will grow rich with wealth. He will rule with his strength and destroy all.

verses.latin: Et usque ad fortitudinem fortificabitur cor ejus: et in dolo interimet multos, et consurget contra principem principum, et sine manu conteretur.
verses.english: He will grow in strength in his heart, and through deceit, he will destroy many. He will rise against the Prince of princes, but he will be broken without human intervention.

verses.latin: Et visio vesperae et mane, quae dicta est, vera est: tu ergo signa visionem, quoniam post multos dies est.
verses.english: The vision of the evening and the morning, which was spoken, is true. Therefore, you must seal up the vision, because it refers to many days from now.

verses.latin: Et ego Daniel languens fui, et aegrotavi: et postquam vidi visionem, et non erat qui interpretaretur.
verses.english: I, Daniel, was exhausted and sick. After I saw the vision, there was no one to interpret it.

verses.latin: Anno primo Darii filii Assueri de genere Medorum, qui regnavit super regnum Chaldaeorum:
verses.english: In the first year of Darius, son of Ahasuerus, of the line of the Medes, who ruled over the Chaldean kingdom:

verses.latin: anno primo imperii ejus, ego Daniel intellexi in libris numerum annorum, de quo sermo Domini factus fuerat ad Jeremiam prophetam, ut complerentur desolationes Jerusalem, septuaginta anni.
verses.english: In the first year of his reign, I, Daniel, was reading the prophetic books. I understood the number of years that the Lord had told to the prophet Jeremiah—that Jerusalem would be desolate for seventy years.

verses.latin: Et posui faciem meam ad Dominum Deum meum, orare et obsecrare in jejuniis et sacco et cinere.
verses.english: And so I turned to God in prayer, fasting, and wearing sackcloth and ashes.

verses.latin: Et oravi Dominum Deum meum, et confessus sum, et dixi: Obsecro, Domine Deus magne et terribilis, custodiens pactum et misericordiam diligentibus te, et custodientibus mandata tua:
verses.english: I prayed to the Lord, my God, and I confessed, saying: “O Lord God, great and awesome, you keep your covenant and show mercy to those who love you and keep your commandments:

verses.latin: Peccavimus, iniquitatem fecimus, impie egimus, et recessimus, et declinavimus a mandatis tuis, et a judiciis tuis.
verses.english: We have sinned and committed iniquity. We have done evil and have rebelled. We have turned away from your commands and your judgments.

verses.latin: Et non audivimus servos tuos prophetas, qui locuti sunt in nomine tuo ad reges nostros, et ad principes nostros, et ad patres nostros, et ad universum populum terrae.
verses.english: We have not listened to your servants the prophets, who spoke in your name to our kings, our leaders, our fathers, and all the people of the land.

verses.latin: Tibi, Domine, justitia: nobis autem confusio faciei, sicut est hodie, viro Juda, et habitatoribus Jerusalem, et universae Israëli, qui prope sunt, et qui procul, in universis terris, ad quas ejecisti eos propter iniquitates eorum, in quibus peccaverunt tibi.
verses.english: To you, O Lord, belongs righteousness; but to us, shame, as at this day—to the men of Judah, the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and all of Israel, both near and far, in all the countries to which you have driven them because of the transgressions with which they have sinned against you.

verses.latin: Domine, nobis confusio faciei, regibus nostris, principibus nostris, et patribus nostris, qui peccaverunt tibi.
verses.english: O Lord, to us belongs shame, to our kings, our leaders, and our fathers, who have sinned against you.

verses.latin: Domino autem Deo nostro misericordia et propitiatio est, quoniam recessimus a eo:
verses.english: But to the Lord our God belongs mercy and forgiveness, for we have rebelled against him:

verses.latin: et non audivimus vocem Domini Dei nostri, ut ambularemus in lege ejus, quam posuit nobis per manum servorum suorum prophetarum.
verses.english: And we have not obeyed the voice of the Lord our God, by following his law, which he set before us by his servants the prophets.

verses.latin: Et omnis Israël praevaricatus est legem tuam, et declinaverunt, ne audirent vocem tuam: et stillavit super nos maledictio, et juramentum quod scriptum est in libro Moysi servi Dei, quoniam peccavimus ei.
verses.english: All of Israel has transgressed your law and turned aside, refusing to obey your voice. So the curse and the oath that are written in the Law of Moses, the servant of God, have been poured out on us, because we have sinned against him.

verses.latin: Et statuit verba sua, quae locutus est contra nos, et contra principes nostros, qui judicaverunt nos, ut induceret super nos magnum malum: quod nunquam factum est sub toto caelo, secundum quod factum est in Jerusalem.
verses.english: And he has confirmed the words that he spoke against us and against our rulers, by bringing upon us a great evil. Never before under the whole universe has anything like what was done to Jerusalem been done.

verses.latin: Sicut scriptum est in lege Moysi, omne malum istud venit super nos: et non rogavimus faciem Domini Dei nostri, ut reverteremur a iniquitatibus nostris, et cogitaremus veritatem tuam.
verses.english: As it is written in the Law of Moses, all this evil has come upon us; yet we have not entreated the favor of the Lord our God, turning from our iniquities and understanding your truth.

verses.latin: Et vigilavit Dominus super malum, et adduxit illud super nos: justus Dominus Deus noster in omnibus operibus suis, quae fecit: quia noluimus audire vocem ejus.
verses.english: Therefore the Lord has kept the evil in store and brought it upon us. For the Lord our God is righteous in all his works that he has done, because we did not obey his voice.

verses.latin: Et nunc, Domine Deus noster, qui eduxisti populum tuum de terra Ægypti in manu forti, et fecisti tibi nomen, sicut est dies haec: peccavimus, impie egimus.
verses.english: And now, O Lord our God, who brought your people out of the land of Egypt with a mighty hand and have made for yourself a name, as at this day, we have sinned and done evil.

verses.latin: Domine, in omnem justitiam tuam, avertatur furor tuus, et ira tua a civitate Jerusalem, sancta tua: quoniam propter peccata nostra, et iniquitates patrum nostrorum, Jerusalem et populus tuus in opprobrium est in omnibus qui in circuitu nostro sunt.
verses.english: O Lord, in all your righteousness, let your anger and your wrath turn away from your city Jerusalem, your holy mountain; for because of our sins and the iniquities of our fathers, Jerusalem and your people have become a byword among all those around us.

verses.latin: Nunc ergo exaudi, Deus noster, orationem servi tui, et obsecrationem ejus: et illumina faciem tuam super sanctuarium tuum quod desolatum est, propter temetipsum.
verses.english: Now therefore, O our God, hear the prayer of your servant and his pleas, and for your own sake, make your face to shine upon your sanctuary, which is desolate.

verses.latin: Inclina, Deus meus, aurem tuam, et audi: aperi oculos tuos, et vide desolationem nostram, et civitatem super quam invocatum est nomen tuum: non enim in justificationibus nostris prosternimus orationes ante faciem tuam, sed in miserationibus tuis multis.
verses.english: O my God, incline your ear and hear. Open your eyes and see our desolations and the city that is called by your name. For we do not present our pleas before you because of our righteousness, but because of your great mercy.

verses.latin: Exaudi, Domine: placare, Domine: adtende et fac: ne moreris, propter temetipsum, Deus meus: quia nomen tuum invocatum est super civitatem tuam et super populum tuum.
verses.english: O Lord, hear! O Lord, forgive! O Lord, pay attention and act! Delay not, for your own sake, O my God, because your name has been called upon your city and your people.”

verses.latin: Cumque adhuc loquerer, et orarem, et confiterer peccata mea, et peccata populi mei Israël, et prosternerem orationes meas in conspectu Dei mei pro monte sancto Dei mei:
verses.english: While I was speaking and praying, confessing my sin and the sin of my people Israel, and presenting my plea before the Lord my God for the holy mountain of my God,

verses.latin: adhuc loquente me in oratione, ecce vir Gabriel, quem videram in visione a principio, cito volans tetigit me in tempore sacrificii vespertini.
verses.english: while I was speaking in prayer, the man Gabriel, whom I had seen in the vision at the beginning, came to me in swift flight at the time of the evening sacrifice.

verses.latin: Et docuit me, et locutus est mihi, et dixit: Daniel, nunc egressus sum ut docerem te intellectum.
verses.english: He made me understand, speaking to me, and saying, “O Daniel, I have now come out to give you insight and understanding.

verses.latin: In principio precum tuarum egressus est sermo: ego autem veni ut ostendam tibi, quia vir desideriorum es: et intellige verbum, et considera visionem.
verses.english: At the beginning of your pleas, a word went out, and I have come to tell it to you, for you are greatly loved. Therefore, consider the word and understand the vision.

verses.latin: Septuaginta hebdomades abbreviatae sunt super populum tuum, et super urbem sanctam tuam, ut consummetur praevaricatio, et finem accipiat peccatum, et deleatur iniquitas, et adducatur justitia sempiterna, et impleatur visio et prophetia, et ungatur Sanctus sanctorum.
verses.english: Seventy weeks are decreed for your people and your holy city, to finish the transgression, to put an end to sin, and to atone for iniquity, to bring in everlasting righteousness, to seal both vision and prophet, and to anoint a most holy place.

verses.latin: Scito ergo, et animadverte: Ab exitu sermonis, ut iterum aedificetur Jerusalem, usque ad Christum ducem, hebdomades septem, et hebdomades sexaginta duae erunt: et rursum aedificabitur platea, et muri in angustia temporum.
verses.english: Know therefore and understand that from the going out of the word to restore and build Jerusalem to the coming of an anointed one, a prince, there shall be seven weeks. Then for sixty-two weeks, it shall be built again with streets and trenches, even in times of distress.

verses.latin: Et post hebdomades sexaginta duas occidetur Christus: et non erit ei populus, qui se negaturus est. Et civitatem et sanctuarium dissipabit populus cum duce venturo: et finis ejus vastitas, et post finem belli statuta desolatio.
verses.english: And after the sixty-two weeks, an anointed one shall be cut off and shall have nothing. And the people of the prince who is to come shall destroy the city and the sanctuary. The end thereof shall be with a flood, and until the end of the war desolations are determined.

verses.latin: Confirmabit autem pactum multis hebdomada una: et in dimidio hebdomadis deficiet hostia et sacrificium: et in templo erit abominatio desolationis: et usque ad consummationem, et finem, perseverabit desolatio.
verses.english: And he shall make a strong covenant with many for one week, and for half of the week he shall put an end to sacrifice and offering. And on the wing of abominations shall come one who makes desolate, until the decreed end is poured out on the desolator.”

verses.latin: Anno tertio Cyri regis Persarum, verbum revelatum est Danieli, cognomento Baltassar. Et verbum verum, et magnum: et intellexit verbum, et sensum habuit in visione.
verses.english: In the third year of the reign of Cyrus, King of the Persians, God revealed His Word to Daniel, also known as Baltassar. This Word was true and important; Daniel understood the Word, and he had the insight of the vision.

verses.latin: In diebus illis, ego Daniel lugebam trium septimanas dierum.
verses.english: During those days, I, Daniel, was in mourning for three weeks.

verses.latin: Panem desiderabilem non comedi: et caro et vinum non introierunt in os meum, neque unguento unctus sum, donec explerentur tres septimanae dierum.
verses.english: I did not eat any of the best foods. Neither meat nor wine entered my mouth, nor did I anoint myself with oil, until the three weeks were finished.

verses.latin: Die autem vigesima et quarta mensis primi, eram juxta flumen magnum, quod est Tigris.
verses.english: On the twenty-fourth day of the first month, I was beside the great river, which is the Tigris.

verses.latin: Et levavi oculos meos, et vidi: et ecce vir unus vestitus lineis: et lumbi ejus accincti auro optimo.
verses.english: I raised my eyes, and I saw: and behold, a man dressed in linen. His waist was girded with the finest gold.

verses.latin: Et corpus ejus quasi chrysolithus: et facies ejus, velut species fulgoris, et oculi ejus, ut lampas ardens: et brachia ejus, et quasi aspectus aeris candentis: et vox verborum ejus, ut vox multitudinis.
verses.english: His body was like chrysolite. His face was like a flash of lightning, and his eyes were like a burning lamp. His arms and his feet had the appearance of gleaming bronze, and the sound of his words was like the sound of a multitude.

verses.latin: Et vidi ego Daniel solus visionem: viri autem qui erant mecum, non viderunt: sed timore magno perterriti, fugerunt, et absconderunt se.
verses.english: I, Daniel, alone saw the vision; the men who were with me did not see it. But they were terrified by a great fear, and fled and hid themselves.

verses.latin: Ego autem relictus solus, vidi visionem grandem hanc, et non remansit in me fortitudo: sed et species mea immutata est in me, et emarcui, nec habui ulla virium.
verses.english: So I was left alone; I saw this great vision, and no strength remained in me. My appearance was also changed in me, and I became weak, and I had no strength at all.

verses.latin: Et audivi vocem verborum ejus: cumque audissem, cecidi in soporem, facie mea in terram.
verses.english: Then I heard the sound of his words; and when I heard them, I fell asleep, with my face on the ground.

verses.latin: Et ecce manus tetigit me, et erexit me: et statuit me in loco meo.
verses.english: Suddenly, a hand touched me, and raised me; and it set me in my place.

verses.latin: Et dixit mihi: Daniel vir desideriorum, intellige verba quae ego loquor ad te, et sta in gradu tuo: nunc enim missus sum ad te. Cumque dixisset mihi verbum istud, steti tremens.
verses.english: He said to me, “Daniel, man greatly beloved, understand the words that I am speaking to you, and stand upright, for I have now been sent to you.” When he said this word to me, I stood trembling.

verses.latin: Et dixit ad me: Noli timere Daniel: quia ex die primo, quo posuisti cor tuum ad intelligendum, et ad affligendum te in conspectu Dei tui, exaudita sunt verba tua: et ego veni propter sermones tuos.
verses.english: And he said to me: “Do not be afraid, Daniel, for from the first day that you set your heart to understand, and to humble yourself before your God, your words were heard. I have come because of your words.

verses.latin: Princeps autem regni Persarum restitit mihi viginti et uno diebus: et ecce Michael, unus de principibus primis, venit in adjutorium mihi: et ego remansi ibi juxta regem Persarum.
verses.english: But the prince of the kingdom of Persia resisted me for twenty-one days; and behold, Michael, one of the first princes, came to help me, and I remained there with the king of Persia.

verses.latin: Veni autem ut docerem te quae ventura sunt populo tuo in novissimis diebus: adhuc enim visio in dies.
verses.english: Now I have come to make you understand what will happen to your people in the latter days, for the vision is for many days yet.”

verses.latin: Et cum diceret mihi verba haec, inclinavi vultum meum in terram, et tacui.
verses.english: When he said these words to me, I turned my face toward the ground and was silent.

verses.latin: Et ecce quasi similitudo filii hominis tetigit labia mea: et aperui os meum, et locutus sum, et dixi ad eum qui stabat contra me: Domine mi, in visione tua conturbatus sum, et consumptus sum: nec remansit in me fortitudo.
verses.english: Then, behold, something like the likeness of the sons of men touched my lips; and I opened my mouth and spoke and said to him who stood before me, “My lord, because of your vision, I am terrified and am undone, and no strength remains in me.

verses.latin: Et quomodo potest servus Domini mei loqui cum Domino meo? statim enim non remansit in me fortitudo, et spiritus meus non est relictus in me.
verses.english: For how can the servant of my lord speak with my lord? For as for me, strength has immediately been taken from me, and my spirit has not remained in me.”

verses.latin: Rursum ergo tetigit me quasi species hominis, et confortavit me,
verses.english: Again, the likeness of a man touched me and strengthened me,

verses.latin: et dixit: Noli timere, vir desideriorum: pax tibi: confortare, et esto robustus. Et cum loqueretur mecum, roboratus sum, et dixi: Loquere, Domine mi, quia confortasti me.
verses.english: and said: “Do not fear, man of desires, peace be to you; be strong and of good courage.” And when he spoke with me, I was strengthened and said: “Speak, my lord, for you have strengthened me.”

verses.latin: Et dixit: Numquid scis quare veni ad te? et nunc revertar ut proeliar contra principem Persarum. Cumque egrederer, ecce princeps Graeciae venit.
verses.english: He said, “Do you know why I came to you? Now I will return to fight against the prince of Persia; and when I leave, the prince of Greece will come.

verses.latin: Verumtamen indicabo tibi quod est expressum in scriptura veritatis: et nemo est adjutor meus in his, nisi Michael princeps vester.
verses.english: However, I will tell you what is written in the Scripture of Truth. There is no one to help me against these, except Michael, your prince.

verses.latin: Et ego in anno primo Darìi Medi, constitutus sum ut essem corroborator et auxiliator ei.
verses.english: I, in the first year of Darius the Mede, was set to be a support and help to him.

verses.latin: Et nunc veritatem annuntiabo tibi. Ecce adhuc tres reges stabunt in Perside, et quartus ditabitur divitiis plurimum prae omnibus: et cum obtinuerit potentiam suam in divitiis, concitabit omnia adversum regnum Graeciae.
verses.english: Now, I will announce the truth to you: behold, three more kings will rise up in Persia, and a fourth will be much richer than all the others; and when he gets power and wealth, he will stir up everything against the kingdom of Greece.

verses.latin: Surget autem rex fortis, et dominabitur magna potestate, et faciet quod ei placuerit.
verses.english: Then a strong king will rise, and he will rule with great power, and he will do whatever he pleases.

verses.latin: Cum autem steterit, conteretur regnum ejus, et dividetur in quatuor ventos caeli: sed non in posteros ejus, neque secundum potentiam ejus qua dominatus est: quoniam scindetur regnum ejus, et dabitur alteris praeter eos.
verses.english: And when he has risen up, his kingdom will be broken, and it will be divided into the four winds of the sky; but not among his descendants, nor according to the power with which he ruled: for his kingdom will be uprooted, and given to others besides them.

verses.latin: Et confortabitur rex austri: et unus de principibus ejus praevalebit super eum, et dominabitur: et dominatio ejus, dominabitur potentia.
verses.english: The king of the south will become strong, and one of his princes will prevail over him, and will rule; and his dominion will be a powerful one.

verses.latin: Et post annos conjunctionis, adhaerebit alter alteri filia regis austri, ut faciat pacem: et non obtinebit fortitudinem brachii ejus, nec stabit, et semen ejus: sed tradetur ipsa, et qui adduxerunt eam, et qui genuerunt eam, in tempore isto.
verses.english: And after years of alliance, the daughter of the king of the south will join the other, to make peace, but she will not have the strength of his arm, nor will she stand, nor will her seed; but she will be handed over, and those who brought her, and those who gave her birth, at this time.

verses.latin: Et surget de germine radicum ejus, plantatio, et veniet cum exercitu, et ingredietur in praesidia regis aquilonis: et faciet in eis, et obtinebit.
verses.english: And a shoot from the roots of her seed will rise up, and he will come with an army, and enter into the fortresses of the king of the north; and he will act against them, and prevail.

verses.latin: Et deos eorum, et simulacra, et vasa pretiosa argenti, et auri, cum captivis adducet in Aegyptum: et ipse per annos praevalebit super regem aquilonis.
verses.english: He will bring their gods, and their idols, and the precious vessels of silver and gold, with the captives, into Egypt; and he will prevail for years over the king of the north.

verses.latin: Et ingredietur in regnum rex aquilonis, et revertetur in terram suam.
verses.english: And the king of the north will enter into his kingdom, and return to his own land.

verses.latin: Filii autem ejus bellabunt, et congregabunt multitudinem magnam: et veniet ruens, et inundans, et revertetur, et bellum movebit usque ad praesidia ejus.
verses.english: But his sons will wage war, and they will gather a great multitude; and it will come, rushing, and overflowing, and return, and wage war up to his fortresses.

verses.latin: Et commovebitur rex austri, et exibit et pugnabit contra regem aquilonis: et praeparabit multitudinem magnam, et tradetur multitudo in manu ejus.
verses.english: And the king of the south will be stirred up, and he will go out and fight against the king of the north; and he will prepare a great multitude, and the multitude will be handed over into his hand.

verses.latin: Et elevabitur multitudo, et exaltabitur cor ejus: et dejiciet millia: sed non praevalebit.
verses.english: And the multitude will be lifted up, and his heart will be exalted; and he will cast down thousands: but he will not prevail.

verses.latin: Revertetur enim rex aquilonis, et praeparabit multitudinem majorem quam prius: et in fine temporum annorum veniet ruens, et inundabit cum grandi apparatu.
verses.english: For the king of the north will return, and prepare a greater multitude than before; and at the end of the times, he will come rushing, and overflow with a great army.

verses.latin: Et in illis temporibus multi consurgent contra regem austri: filii quoque praevaricatorum populi tui erigantur ut conpleant visionem, et corruent.
verses.english: And in those times many will rise against the king of the south; also the children of the transgressors of your people will rise up to fulfill the vision, but they will fall.

verses.latin: Et veniet rex aquilonis, et conportabit aggerem, et capiet urbes munitas: et brachia austri non sustinebunt, et electi ejus non stabunt in viribus suis.
verses.english: And the king of the north will come, and cast up a mound, and take fortified cities; and the arms of the south will not be able to hold out, and his chosen ones will not stand firm in their strength.

verses.latin: Et faciet qui venerit contra eum, secundum voluntatem suam, et non erit qui resistat contra faciem ejus: et stabit in terra inclyta, et in manu ejus erit devastatio.
verses.english: And he who comes against him will do according to his own will, and there will be no one who can resist him; and he will stand in the glorious land, and destruction will be in his hand.

verses.latin: Et ponet faciem suam ut veniat ad tenendum universum regnum ejus, et recta: et faciet cum eo pactum: filiam quoque feminarum dabit ei, ut eam disperdat: et non stabit, nec erit ei.
verses.english: And he will set his face to come and seize the whole kingdom, and do it straightforwardly; and he will make a covenant with him; and he will give him the daughter of women, to destroy her; but she will not stand, nor will she be for him.

verses.latin: Et convertet faciem suam in insulas, et capiet multas: et cessabit dux opprobrii, et rediet opprobrium ejus.
verses.english: And he will turn his face to the islands, and will take many; and the commander of the disgrace will cease, and his disgrace will return.

verses.latin: Et revertetur in terram suam, et corruet: et non invenietur.
verses.english: And he will return to his own land, and will fall; and he will not be found.

verses.latin: Et stabit in loco ejus opprobrium, quod transibit per excellentiam regni: et in paucis diebus conteretur in furore, non in praelio.
verses.english: And in his place will arise one of the disgrace, who will pass through the glory of the kingdom; and he will be broken in a few days, not in battle.

verses.latin: Et stabit in loco ejus vir vilis, et non dabitur ei honor regius: et veniet clam, et obtinebit regnum in fraudulentia.
verses.english: And in his place will arise a contemptible man, and the royal honor will not be given to him; and he will come secretly, and obtain the kingdom by deceit.

verses.latin: Et brachia inundantium inundabunt coram eo, et conterentur a facie ejus: sed et dux foederis.
verses.english: And the arms of the flood will flood before him, and they will be broken before him; and also the leader of the covenant.

verses.latin: Et post pactum ejus, faciet dolum, et ascendet, et superabit in fortitudine cum parva manu.
verses.english: And after his pact, he will act deceitfully, and will ascend, and will prevail in strength with a small hand.

verses.latin: Et ingressus est in pinguia provinciarum, et faciet quae non fecerunt patres ejus, neque patres patrum ejus: rapinas, et praedam, et divitias dissipabit eis, et contra civitates conponet cogitationes suas, et usque ad tempus.
verses.english: He will enter into the richest parts of the provinces, and he will do what his fathers have not done, nor his fathers' fathers; he will scatter spoils, and plunder, and wealth among them, and will devise his schemes against the fortified cities, for a time.

verses.latin: Et suscitabit vires suas, et animum suum in potentia magna adversum regem austri: et iste provocabitur ad bellum cum magnis copiis et fortibus valde: et non stabit, quoniam inibunt contra eum consilia.
verses.english: And he will stir up his forces, and his mind in great power against the king of the south; and this one will be provoked to war with great and very strong forces; but he will not stand, because they will devise schemes against him.

verses.latin: Et comedentes cibos ejus conterent eum, et exercitus ejus vastabitur: et cadent interfecti plurimi.
verses.english: And those who eat his food will break him, and his army will be destroyed; and many will fall slain.

verses.latin: Duorum autem regum cor erit ut faciant malum, et ad mensam unam loquentur mendacium, et non proficient: quia adhuc finis in diem statutum.
verses.english: But the hearts of the two kings will be to do evil, and at one table they will speak a lie; but it will not succeed, because the end is still for the appointed day.

verses.latin: Et revertetur in terram suam cum substantia magna, et cor ejus contra testamentum sanctum, et faciet et revertetur in terram suam.
verses.english: And he will return to his land with great wealth, and his heart will be against the holy covenant; and he will act and return to his land.

verses.latin: In tempore statuto revertetur, et veniet contra austrum: et non erit sicut fuit in superioribus, et in posterioribus.
verses.english: At the appointed time he will return, and come against the south; but it will not be as it was before, and afterwards.

verses.latin: Et venient in eum trieres Chitti, et contristabitur, et revertetur: et irascetur contra testamentum sanctum, et faciet: et revertetur, et cogitabit cum his qui dereliquerunt testamentum sanctum.
verses.english: And the ships of the Kittim will come against him, and he will be grieved, and will return; and he will be angry against the holy covenant, and he will act; and he will return, and consider those who have forsaken the holy covenant.

verses.latin: Et brachia ex eo stabunt, et contaminabunt sanctuarium fortitudinis, et auferent iuge sacrificium: et dabunt abominationem in desolationem.
verses.english: And arms will arise from him, and they will defile the sanctuary of strength, and take away the continual sacrifice, and set up the abomination that makes desolate.

verses.latin: Et impii in testamentum simulabunt fraudulenter: porro populus sciens Deum suum, confortabitur, et faciet.
verses.english: And the wicked will act deceitfully against the covenant; but the people who know their God will be strong, and will act.

verses.latin: Et docti in populo docebunt multos: et ruent in gladio, et in flamma, et in captivitate, et in rapina, diebus.
verses.english: And those who have understanding among the people will instruct many; but they will fall by the sword, and by flame, and by captivity, and by plunder, for a time.

verses.latin: Cumque corruerint, adjuvabuntur in auxilio parvo: et adjungentur eis multi fraudulenter.
verses.english: And when they fall, they will be helped with a little help; and many will be joined to them deceitfully.

verses.latin: Et de doctoribus corruent, ut probentur, et ellegantur, et dealbentur, usque ad tempus praefinitum: quia adhuc tempus habet.
verses.english: And some of the wise will fall, so that they may be tested, and purified, and made white, until the appointed time; because it still has a time.

verses.latin: Et faciet rex juxta voluntatem suam, et elevabitur, et magnificabitur adversum omnem Deum, et adversum Deum deorum loquetur mirabilia, et dirigetur donec conpleatur ira: quoniam conpletus est finis.
verses.english: And the king will act according to his own will; and he will exalt himself, and magnify himself against every god; and against the God of gods he will speak astonishing things, and will prosper until the wrath is completed; because the end is completed.

verses.latin: Et Deum patrum suorum non reputabit: et in concupiscentiis mulierum, nec Deum quem noverat, respiciet: quia contra omnia magnificabitur.
verses.english: He will not regard the God of his fathers, nor will he look upon the desires of women, nor will he regard any god; for he will magnify himself against all things.

verses.latin: Deum autem fortitudinum in loco suo honorabit: et Deum quem ignoraverant patres ejus, honorabit auro, et argento, et lapide pretioso, rebusque pretiosissimis.
verses.english: But in his place he will honor the god of fortresses; and a god whom his fathers did not know, he will honor with gold, and silver, and precious stones, and most precious things.

verses.latin: Et faciet ut muniat fortitudines munitionis cum Deo alieno: et multiplicabit gloriam, et dabit eis potestatem in multis, et terram dividet gratis.
verses.english: And he will act to fortify the fortresses of the mighty with a foreign god; and he will increase glory, and give them power over many, and divide the land for a price.

verses.latin: Et in tempore praefinito prœliabitur contra eum rex austri: et quasi tempestas impetu veniet contra eum rex aquilonis cum curribus, et equitibus, et navibus multis: et ingredietur terras, et subvertet, et transiet.
verses.english: And at the appointed time, the king of the south will fight against him; and like a tempest, the king of the north will come against him with chariots, and horsemen, and many ships; and he will enter into the lands, and will subvert, and pass through.

verses.latin: Et intrabit in terram inclytam, et multi corruent: salvabuntur autem de manu ejus, hii qui evaserint, Edom, et Moab, et principes filiorum Ammon.
verses.english: And he will enter into the glorious land, and many will fall; but those who escape his hand will be saved, Edom, and Moab, and the chiefs of the children of Ammon.

verses.latin: Et mittet manum suam in terras, et terra Aegypti non evadet.
verses.english: And he will stretch out his hand against the lands, and the land of Egypt will not escape.

verses.latin: Et dominabitur thesauris auri, et argenti, et in omnibus pretiosis Aegypti: et Libyes, et Aethiopas sequentes gressus ejus.
verses.english: And he will have dominion over the treasures of gold, and silver, and over all the precious things of Egypt; and the Libyans and the Ethiopians will follow his steps.

verses.latin: Et turbabunt eum nuntii ab oriente et ab aquilone: et veniet cum multitudine magna ad conterendum et interficiendum plurimos.
verses.english: But messengers from the east and from the north will trouble him; and he will come with a great multitude to destroy and kill many.

verses.latin: Et ponet tabernaculum suum, inter maria, in monte inclyto et sancto: et veniet usque ad summitatem ejus: et non erit qui auxilietur ei.
verses.english: And he will set his tabernacle between the seas, in the glorious and holy mountain; and he will come to its summit; but there will be no one to help him.

verses.latin: Et in tempore illo consurget Michael, princeps magnus, qui stat pro filiis populi tui: et veniet tempus, quale non fuit ex quo gentes esse coeperunt usque in tempus illud. Et in tempore illo salvabitur populus tuus, omnis qui inventus fuerit scriptus in libro.
verses.english: And at that time, the great Michael, a prince of the angels, will rise to defend your people. Then there will be a time of tribulation the likes of which the world has never seen before. But your people will be delivered, everyone written in the book of life.

verses.latin: Et multi de his qui dormiunt in terrae pulvere evigilabunt: alii in vitam aeternam, et alii in opprobrium, ut videant semper.
verses.english: And many who are sleeping in the dust of the earth will awaken: some to eternal life, but others will awaken to eternal punishment and disgrace.

verses.latin: Qui autem docti fuerint, fulgebunt quasi splendor firmamenti: et qui ad justitiam erudiunt multos, quasi stellae in perpetuas aeternitates.
verses.english: Those who are wise will shine like the glory of the universe. And those who lead many to righteousness will shine like the stars forever.

verses.latin: Tu autem, Daniel, claude verba, et signa librum usque ad tempus statutum: multi pertransibunt, et multiplex erit scientia.
verses.english: But you, Daniel, keep the words secret, and seal the book until the appointed time. Many will travel the earth, and knowledge will increase.

verses.latin: Et vidi ego Daniel, et ecce steterunt alii duo: unus hinc in ripa fluminis, et alius hinc in ripa fluminis.
verses.english: Then I, Daniel, looked, and there stood two others: one on this side of the bank of the river, and the other on the other side of the bank of the river.

verses.latin: Et dixi viro qui erat vestitus lineis, qui stabat super aquas fluminis: Quousque finis horum mirabilium?
verses.english: And I said to the man clothed in linen, who was standing above the waters of the river, "How long will it be until the end of these wonders?"

verses.latin: Et audivi virum qui erat vestitus lineis, qui stabat super aquas fluminis, cum levasset manum suam ad caelum, et jurasset per viventem in aeternum, quia in tempore, et tempora, et dimidium temporis. Et cum completa fuerit contritio manus populi sancti, omnia haec complebuntur.
verses.english: I heard the man clothed in linen, who was standing above the waters of the river, raise his right hand toward the sky. He swore by Him who lives forever, that it would be a time, times, and half a time. And when the persecution of the holy people ends, all these things will be fulfilled.

verses.latin: Et ego audivi, et non intellexi. Et dixi: Domine mi, quid erit finis horum?
verses.english: And I heard, but I did not understand. So I said, "My Lord, what will be the end of these things?"

verses.latin: Et dixit: Vade, Daniel, quia clausi sunt, et signati verba usque ad tempus praefinitum.
verses.english: He answered, "Go your way, Daniel, because the words are closed up and sealed until the appointed time.

verses.latin: Lava, et emunda, et proba te. Multi enim mundabuntur, et probabuntur, et urantur: et impii gerent impie, nec intelligent omnes impii, sed docti intelligent.
verses.english: Purify yourselves, and make yourselves clean. Many will be refined, and tested, and purified. The wicked will continue to do wrong, and none of the wicked will understand. But those who are wise will understand.

verses.latin: Et a tempore quando ablatus fuerit juge sacrificium, et data fuerit abominationis desolatio, dies mille ducentos nonaginta.
verses.english: From the time that the daily sacrifice is taken away, and the abomination that causes desolation is set up, there will be 1,290 days.

verses.latin: Beatus qui expectat, et pervenit usque ad mille trecentos triginta quinque dies.
verses.english: Blessed is the one who waits and reaches the end of the 1,335 days.

verses.latin: Tu autem vade ad finem, et requiesces, et stabis in sorte tua in finem dierum.
verses.english: As for you, go your way till the end. You will rest, and then you will rise to receive your allotted inheritance at the end of days.

verses.latin: Habitabat vir in Babylone, et vocabatur Joachim:
verses.english: A man named Joachim lived in Babylon.

verses.latin: et duxit uxorem, nomine Susannam, filiam Helciæ, pulchram nimis, et timentem Deum:
verses.english: He took a wife named Susanna, the very beautiful daughter of Helcias, who was also a woman of deep faith.

verses.latin: parentes autem ejus justi erant, et docuerant filiam suam legem Moysi.
verses.english: Her parents were upright people and taught Susanna the law of Moses.

verses.latin: Porro Joachim dives erat, et habebat hortum adjunctum domui suæ: et ad eum conveniebant Judæi, eo quod esset honorabilior ceteris.
verses.english: Now Joachim was wealthy, and his garden was next to his house. The Jews went to him because he was more respected than the others.

verses.latin: Et constituerant duo seniores de populo judices in illa annona, de quibus dixit Dominus: Egressa est iniquitas de Babylone a senioribus judicibus, qui videbantur regere populum.
verses.english: Two elders from the people were appointed as judges that year, of whom the Lord said: "Wickedness has come forth from Babylon from the elders who seemed to be ruling the people."

verses.latin: Hi erant in domo Joachim, et veniebant ad eos omnes qui habebant negotia.
verses.english: These elders were in Joachim's house, and all who had business came to them.

verses.latin: Cumque recessisset Susanna, in horam meridiei, ire in hortum viri sui,
verses.english: When Susanna left to walk in her husband's garden at midday,

verses.latin: videbant eam seniores ingressam, et ambulantem: et concupiscentia ducti, ardebant in ea cordibus suis,
verses.english: the elders saw her enter and walk there. Driven by lust, their hearts burned for her.

verses.latin: et aversi sunt oculos suos.
verses.english: They turned their gaze away.

verses.latin: Et postquam recesserunt, ingressa est in hortum, et ambulabat. Cumque esset calida, voluit lavari in horto.
verses.english: After they withdrew, she entered the garden and walked there. It was hot, so she wanted to bathe in the garden.

verses.latin: Erat autem ibi vas magnum: et aperuit vas, et voluit lavari.
verses.english: There was a large container there. She opened it, wanting to bathe.

verses.latin: Et erant duo seniores absconditi, et observabant eam.
verses.english: The two elders were hiding, watching her.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Susannæ: Affer nobis oleum, et unguenta, et claudes ostia horti, ut lavemur.
verses.english: Susanna said, "Bring us oil and ointments, and close the doors of the garden so we can bathe."

verses.latin: Et illi clamaverunt, et cluserunt ostia horti, et dimiserunt servos suos exire, et cluserunt ostia.
verses.english: They shouted, closed the doors of the garden, sent their servants away, and shut the doors.

verses.latin: Cumque egressi essent servi, surrexerunt duo seniores, et cucurrerunt ad eam.
verses.english: When the servants had left, the two elders rose and rushed toward her.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt ei: Ecce, ostia horti clausa sunt, et nemo nos videt, et concupiscimus te: quapropter accede ad nos, et esto nobiscum.
verses.english: They said to her, "The doors of the garden are closed, and no one sees us. We desire you; therefore, yield to us and be with us."

verses.latin: Quæ dixit eis: Non est mihi consilium hoc facere: sed melius est mihi incidere in manus vestras, quam peccare in conspectu Domini.
verses.english: She said to them, "I will not do this. It is better for me to fall into your hands than to sin in the sight of the Lord."

verses.latin: Exclamavit ergo Susanna voce magna: et clamaverunt contra eam seniores.
verses.english: So Susanna cried out in a loud voice, and the elders cried out against her.

verses.latin: Et cucurrerunt unusquisque in viam suam.
verses.english: Each of them ran off in his own direction.

verses.latin: Et dixit unus ad alterum: Quid hoc est quod factum est?
verses.english: One said to the other, "What is this that has happened?"

verses.latin: Et reversi seniores, et congregati contra eam, et dixerunt: Susannam, filiam Helciæ, et uxorem Joachim, cepimus, ambulantem in horto cum juvene quodam, et hunc apprehendimus: et quia noluit confiteri, occidimus eum.
verses.english: The elders returned and gathered against her, saying, "We caught Susanna, the daughter of Helcias and the wife of Joachim, walking in the garden with a young man, and we apprehended him. Since he refused to confess, we killed him."

verses.latin: Et statim dixerunt se vidisse eam cum juvene: et hoc testimonium eorum.
verses.english: They immediately said they had seen her with the young man, and this was their testimony.

verses.latin: Et factum est, mane, convocata est synagoga populi, et venerunt seniores judicum cum Susanna.
verses.english: In the morning, the assembly of the people was gathered, and the elders of the judges came with Susanna.

verses.latin: Missaque est a viris suis, et a parentibus suis, et a servis suis. Et flevit Susanna.
verses.english: She was sent by her husband, her parents, and her servants. Susanna wept.

verses.latin: Cumque esset in conspectu omnium, dixerunt seniores: Mitte eam, et faciamus judicium.
verses.english: When she was in the sight of everyone, the elders said, "Send her away, and let us render judgment."

verses.latin: Et dixit ad eam: Dic nobis sub qua arbore eos simul cepisti.
verses.english: They said to her, "Tell us under what tree you caught them together."

verses.latin: Quæ respondit: Sub masticho. Et dixit: Profecto mentita es tibi in caput.
verses.english: She replied, "Under a mastic tree." And she said, "You have lied to your own detriment."

verses.latin: Et cum respicerent in se invicem, dixerunt: Dic nobis sub qua arbore deprehendisti eos in mutua conversatione?
verses.english: As they looked at each other, they said, "Tell us under what tree you caught them in conversation."

verses.latin: Quæ dixit: Sub prino. Et dixit: Profecto mentita es, et mentiri non cessabis.
verses.english: She said, "Under an holm oak." And she said, "You have lied, and you will not cease lying."

verses.latin: Et cum omnia dicta essent, clamabant omnes, et dicebant: Occidatur. Et clamabat in voce magna Susanna, et flebat, quia innocens erat.
verses.english: When all was said, everyone cried out and said, "Let her be killed!" Susanna cried out in a loud voice and wept because she was innocent.

verses.latin: Tunc surrexit Daniel, et dixit: Iniqui estis filii Israël, et judicium falsum fecistis contra filiam Israël.
verses.english: Then Daniel stood up and said, "You sons of Israel are wicked, and you have rendered a false judgment against the daughter of Israel!"

verses.latin: Reversusque est omnis populus ad eum. Et dixit: Stulte estis filii Israël: sine judicio, et sine scientia condemnastis filiam Israël?
verses.english: All the people returned to him. He said, "You are foolish sons of Israel! Without judgment and without knowledge, have you condemned the daughter of Israel?"

verses.latin: Revertimini ad judicium: quia falsum testimonium dixerunt contra eam.
verses.english: Return to the judgment, for they have given false testimony against her."

verses.latin: Et festinans Daniel, dixit: Dividite eos, et non accedat unusquisque ad alterum.
verses.english: Daniel, hastening, said, "Separate them, and let them not approach each other."

verses.latin: Et cum divisi essent, vocavit unum ex eis, et dixit ei: O veterane dierum nequitiae, nunc venerunt peccata tua quæ operabaris prius,
verses.english: When they were separated, he called one of them and said to him, "O elder of wicked days, now your sins, which you committed before, have come to light,

verses.latin: judicans judicia falsa, et innocentes condemnans, et dimittens noxios, cum Dominus dicat: Innocens et justum non occides.
verses.english: judging false judgments, condemning the innocent, and acquitting the guilty, even though the Lord says, 'You shall not kill the innocent and the just.'"

verses.latin: Nunc ergo, si vidisti eam, dic sub qua arbore videris eos conversantes inter se?
verses.english: Now then, if you saw her, tell us under what tree you saw them conversing together."

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Sub prino.
verses.english: He replied, "Under an holm oak."

verses.latin: Et dixit Daniel: Recte mentitus es in caput tuum: ecce enim angelus Dei, habens gladium, expectat te, ut disperdat te.
verses.english: Then Daniel said, "You have lied to your own detriment! For behold, the angel of God, holding a sword, awaits you to destroy you."

verses.latin: Et amoto eo, jussit alterum venire: et dixit ei: Semen Chanaan, et non Juda, species decipiens, et error non te vinciat.
verses.english: And when he had removed him, he ordered the other to come. He said to him, "Seed of Canaan, not of Judah, a deceptive appearance, and let not error deceive you."

verses.latin: Quid tu dixisti eam vidisse cum juvene ambulantem, et concupiscentiam habuisti in ea?
verses.english: Why did you say you saw her walking with a young man, when you had lust for her?"

verses.latin: Qui respondit: Sub masticho.
verses.english: He replied, "Under a mastic tree."

verses.latin: Et dixit ei Daniel: Et tu quoque mentitus es in caput tuum: expectat enim angelus Dei gladium, ut et te intercidat.
verses.english: Then Daniel said to him, "And you also have lied to your own detriment, for the angel of God awaits with a sword to cut you to pieces."

verses.latin: Et exclamavit omnis congregatio voce magna, et benedixerunt Deum, qui salvat sperantes in se.
verses.english: And the whole assembly cried out with a loud voice and blessed God, who saves those who hope in Him.

verses.latin: Et consurrexerunt contra duos seniores: (quoniam Daniel eos de testimonio falso arguiderat) et fecerunt eis sicut male egerant.
verses.english: They rose against the two elders (because Daniel had convicted them of false testimony), and they did to them as they had wickedly planned.

verses.latin: Et interfecerunt eos: et salvata est anima innocens in die illa.
verses.english: They put them to death, and the innocent life was saved that day.

verses.latin: Et Helcias et uxor ejus laudaverunt Deum pro filia sua Susanna, cum Joachim viro ejus, quia non esset inventa in ea res turpis.
verses.english: And Helcias and his wife praised God for their daughter Susanna, along with her husband Joachim, because no shameful thing had been found in her.

verses.latin: Et Daniel magnus factus est in conspectu populi a die illa, et deinceps.
verses.english: And Daniel became great in the sight of the people from that day forward.

verses.latin: Et erat in terra propheta Habacuc, et tulit pultem et frustrum panis, et in vase portavit ad falcatores in campo.
verses.english: And in the land was the prophet Habakkuk, and he took a meal of stew and a loaf of bread and carried it in a container to the harvesters in the field.

verses.latin: Porro draco Bel, cum essemus simul, comedit omnia quae illi porrigebantur.
verses.english: Now the dragon of Bel, as we were together, consumed all of the offerings that were given to him.

verses.latin: Dixit ergo Habacuc: Da mihi, Domine, pultem et panem, ut dem falcatoribus.
verses.english: Therefore, Habakkuk said, “Lord, give me the stew and the bread, so I may give it to the harvesters.”

verses.latin: Et angelus Domini rapuit Habacuc per crinem capitis, et tulit eum in Babylonem, et in laciis, et cum impetu spiritus sui posuit eum super lacum.
verses.english: And an angel of the Lord grabbed Habakkuk by the hair of his head and carried him to Babylon, to the lion’s den, and with the force of his spirit, he placed him above the den.

verses.latin: Et dixit Habacuc: Habacuc, da prandium Habacuc, quem misisti in Babylonem.
verses.english: Then Habakkuk spoke, “Habakkuk, give the meal to Habakkuk, whom you sent to Babylon.”

verses.latin: Et dedit Habacuc prandium Habacuc.
verses.english: And Habakkuk gave Habakkuk the meal.

verses.latin: Porro Bel, et sacerdotibus ejus, et omni populo, comedit quod erat illic.
verses.english: Bel and his priests, along with all the people, ate the offerings that were there.

verses.latin: Et illi autem, cum vidissent hoc, clamabant voce magna: Magnus est Bel.
verses.english: But when they saw this, they cried out with a loud voice, “Great is Bel!”

verses.latin: Sed Daniel ridebat, et apprehendit Bel, et interfecit illum, et sacerdotes ejus dedit in potestatem Danielis.
verses.english: But Daniel laughed and seized Bel, killing him and handing his priests over to Daniel’s power.

verses.latin: Et dixit: Ecce, qui est iste? Videsne, Domine?
verses.english: And he said, “Look, who is this? Do you see, Lord?”

verses.latin: Et dixit rex: Deducantur in conspectum meum, et probabo quis eorum hoc fecerit.
verses.english: And the king said: “Let them be brought before me, and I will determine who among them has done this.”

verses.latin: Et cum fuissent congregati, et probati a rege, inventi sunt trecenti sacerdotes mendaces; et jussit eos interfici, et dedit Bel in potestatem ejus: et contrivit eum, et templum ejus destruxit.
verses.english: And when they were gathered and tested by the king, three hundred lying priests were found. He ordered them to be killed and gave Bel to Daniel’s power. And he destroyed him, and destroyed his temple.

verses.latin: In eodem loco erat serpens magnus, quem colebant Babylonii.
verses.english: In the same place was a great serpent, which the Babylonians worshipped.

verses.latin: Et dixit rex Danieli: Non dices quia hic serpens est aereus? Ecce, vivus est: manducat et bibit: tu non potes dicere quod non sit deus vivus; ideo adora eum.
verses.english: And the king said to Daniel: “Do not say that this serpent is made of bronze? Look, it is alive; it eats and drinks; you cannot say that it is not a living god; therefore, adore him.”

verses.latin: Et dixit Daniel: Dominum Deum meum adorabo; quia ipse est Deus vivus: hic autem serpens non est Deus vivus.
verses.english: And Daniel said, “I will worship my Lord God; because He is the living God; but this serpent is not a living God.”

verses.latin: Tunc accepit Daniel picem, et adipem, et pilos, et coxit haec simul: et fecit massas, et dedit in os serpentis: et rumpuit se serpens.
verses.english: Then Daniel took pitch, fat, and hair and cooked these things together; he made them into masses, and gave them to the serpent. The serpent burst.

verses.latin: Et dixerunt Babylonii: Rex, quia manducavit serpentes: Daniel interfecit serpentem.
verses.english: And the Babylonians said, “King, because the serpent ate the offerings, Daniel killed the serpent.”

verses.latin: Et cum audisset hoc rex, iratus est, et tradidit eum Danieli; et dederunt eum leonibus, et erat illic per sex dies.
verses.english: And when the king heard this, he was angry and handed Daniel over, and they gave him to the lions, and he remained there for six days.

verses.latin: Et erant in Judea duo prophetae: quorum unus Habacuc, alter Daniel.
verses.english: And there were two prophets in Judea: one was Habakkuk, the other Daniel.

verses.latin: Et angelus Domini tulit Habacuc de Judea in Babylonem; et misit eum in lacum leonum.
verses.english: And the angel of the Lord took Habakkuk from Judea to Babylon and sent him into the lion’s den.

verses.latin: In die autem septimo, venit rex, et vidit Daniel sedentem in medio leonum, et adoravit: et dixit: Magnus es, Domine Deus Danielis, et non est alius praeter te.
verses.english: On the seventh day, the king came and saw Daniel sitting in the middle of the lions, and he worshiped and said, “You are great, Lord, the God of Daniel, and there is no other besides you.”

verses.latin: Et eduxit eum de lacu leonum.
verses.english: And he brought him out of the lion’s den.

verses.latin: Porro hi qui interficere Danielis voluerant, dati sunt in lacum leonum: et consumpti sunt in momento coram eis.
verses.english: Now those who wanted to kill Daniel were given to the lions and were consumed immediately before them.

verses.latin: Tunc rex ait: Timeant omnes qui habitant in universa terra, Deum Danielis: quia ipse est salvator, faciens signa et portenta in terra.
verses.english: Then the king said, “Let all those who dwell in the entire land fear the God of Daniel, because He is the savior, performing signs and wonders on the earth.”
